Title: Junior Data Scientist - Area Products & Services
Description:
Company Description

Fineco Bank is a leading European bank with a 20 years history and a fully digital DNA with a branchless approach since the start. Fineco is one of the banks with the widest products range available. We have developed a truly one-stop-solution which includes trading, investment and payment services. We have developed a 100% proprietary platform for trading and investment which covers all customer needs from trading listed and OTC product to investment product such as mutual funds and ETF. In addition to this we also offer banking and payment solution for domestic and international demand.

Position

Inserito all'interno della Unit Business Intelligence – appartenente all'Area Global Business,

la risorsa da noi ricercata si occuperà di fornire supporto analitico con particolare focus sull’area Brokerage.

In questo ambito si occuperà di analisi relative allo sviluppo di nuovi prodotti e al monitoraggio del portafoglio prodotti esistenti. Le analisi riguardano i prodotti da tutti i punti di vista: dalla Customer Base, al Pricing, alla Redditività.

Dovrà possedere doti di precisione e autonomia, partendo dalla comprensione del problema di business, fino all’estrazione dei dati e alla presentazione dei risultati.

Considerata la centralità del ruolo all’interno del processo di sviluppo prodotti, la risorsa dovrà essere in grado di comunicare con colleghi delle diverse aree della Banca: dal Business, al Risk management, dal Finance all’IT:

Attività


Effettuare analisi in autonomia, dalla fase di estrazione dati alla presentazione dei risultati
Produrre report automatizzati utilizzando tool di Business Intelligence
Costruire modelli predittivi al fine di ottimizzare le azioni di marketing



Requirements

Requisiti


Laurea in Economia, Ingegneria Gestionale, Statistica o Matematica
Forte interesse per la finanza, il trading e gli investimenti
Esperienza fino a 3 anni in ruoli analoghi
Eccellenti abilità analitiche e quantitative
Dimostrato interesse per Machine Learning e le analisi di marketing
Buone capacità di interpretazione e di comunicazione dei risultati
Conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione (R, Python, Matlab)
Conoscenza di SQL o database relazionali
Ottima conoscenza di Excel e PowerPoint



Verranno Considerati Un Plus


Conoscenza di applicativi di Business Intelligence
Conoscenza di cluster analysis, modelli di regressione e classificazione, alberi decisionali



Completano il profilo l’entusiasmo e la proattività nel cercare e proporre soluzioni, capacità di lavorare sotto pressione, attitudine al team working e doti relazionali.

Other information

Sede di lavoro: Milano (alternanza presenza in sede e smart working)

Il Gruppo Fineco è orgoglioso di essere un Equal Opportunity Employer e si impegna a creare un ambiente di lavoro sicuro e inclusivo, fondato sul rispetto reciproco e la valorizzazione di qualsiasi diversità, offrendo pari opportunità di lavoro. Fineco “The Place To Be”

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you looking for a new challenge?

Fancy helping us shape the future of car insurance?

Prima could be the place for you.

Since 2015, we’ve been using our love of data and tech to rethink car insurance and bring drivers a great experience at a great price. Our story began in Italy, where we’ve quickly become the number one online motor insurance provider. In fact, we’re trusted by over 4 million drivers. And now we’re expanding to help millions more drivers in the UK and Spain.

To help fuel that growth, we need a Data Scientist to join our Italian Pricing & Underwritingteam (if you're curious, you can get a glimpse of the team's life here ).

This team is the strategic engine behind Prima’s growth.

As part of this team, you’ll play a pivotal role in shaping our strategy and strengthening our competitive edge. Using creativity, data and machine learning, you’ll help predict the future and set the right prices, keeping our offering both attractive and sustainable. You’ll work with your data science tools and skills to bring real-world impact, collaborating with cross-functional teams to turn insights into action and fuel innovation across the company.

Excited to make an impact? Here are the details

What You’ll Do


Leverage Machine Learning and advanced data analytics to identify risks and opportunities for each new client;
Analyze and interpret complex data to support strategic decision-making;
Contribute directly to the company’s growth and long-term success through actionable insights.


What We’re Looking For


Academic Excellence: Impressive academic achievements in Mathematics, Physics, Mathematical Engineering, Physical Engineering, or Statistics;
Experience Not Required: No prior work experience? No problem! We're eager to invest in your talent and education;
Analytical Prowess: Strong quantitative, logical, and analytical skills are essential. At Prima, you'll tackle diverse and stimulating challenges that will put your skills to the test;
Curiosity and Innovation: We value curiosity, proactivity, and pragmatism. You'll be encouraged to pursue common goals in original and innovative ways, shaping the future with your ideas.


Nice-to-have


Have international experience and are fluency in English;
Possess a solid foundation in programming and machine learning;
Know how to create, manipulate and analyze large datasets.


Why you’ll love it here

We want to make Prima a happy and empowering place to work. So if you decide to join us, you can expect plenty of perks.

🤸 Work Your Way: Enjoy full flexibility – work from home, the office or a mix of both. Plus, work from anywhere for up to 30 days a year.

🏁 Grow with us: We may move fast at Prima, but we move together. Get access to learning resources, mentorship and a growth plan tailored to you.

🌈 Thrive and perform: Your best work begins when you feel your best. Enjoy private healthcare, gym discounts, wellbeing programs and mental health support.

Think you’re a match? Apply now.

At Prima, we celebrate uniqueness. If you don’t meet every requirement but are passionate about this role, we still want to hear from you. Innovation thrives on diverse perspectives.

Prima is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Need accommodations during the process? Email us at talent.acquisition@prima.it. Let’s build the future of insurance, together.

Title: Data Scientist - Urologia
HTML:
L'IRCCS Ospedale San Raffaele, struttura clinica-scientifica-universitaria di rilievo internazionale e di alta specializzazione per diverse importanti patologie, sta ricercando un Data Scientist da inserire nella propria Unità Operativa di Urologia.

Responsabilità:

  • Condurre analisi statistiche in diversi progetti di ricerca clinica;
  • Collaborare con enti esterni in un progetto in corso nell’ambito della surgical data science;
  • Progettare e mantenere dashboard per il controllo della qualità;
  • Elaborare, pulire e strutturare dataset clinici;
  • Progettare, sviluppare e validare modelli di deep learning per applicazioni cliniche;
  • Seguire e supportare studenti magistrali durante lo svolgimento della tesi.


Qualifiche Obbligatorie:

  • Laurea in Data Science, Informatica, Ingegneria Biomedica o un campo correlato;
  • Solida conoscenza della statistica e dell’analisi dei dati;
  • Ottima padronanza di Python e/o R, con esperienza concreta nell’utilizzo di librerie come TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, Pandas, SHAP;
  • Competenze nella visualizzazione dei dati (es. matplotlib, seaborn o simili);
  • Esperienza nell’uso di PowerBI o strumenti equivalenti per la creazione di dashboard;
  • Esperienza pratica in progetti di ML/deep learning;
  • Esperienza in ambito di ricerca, preferibilmente clinica;
  • Inglese fluente (sia scritto che parlato).


Qualifiche Desiderabili:

  • PhD in un campo pertinente;
  • Esperienza con NLP (Natural Language Processing) e modelli linguistici di grandi dimensioni (LLMs);
  • Conoscenza dei sistemi di controllo versione (Git);
  • Familiarità con Microsoft Azure per il deployment e la gestione di modelli AI basati su cloud;


Dettagli lavorativi:

  • Tipologia contrattuale: contratto di collaborazione;
  • Durata: un anno, rinnovabile.
  • Sede: IRCCS Ospedale San Raffaele, via Olgettina 60, Milano.

Title: Data Scientist (with AI)
Description:
Join a dynamic data team tackling cutting-edge GenAI projects with real business impact.

You’ll work at the intersection of AI innovation and enterprise-scale implementation, driving meaningful results from concept to deployment.




What you will do

Identify high-impact Generative AI use cases in collaboration with business and tech teams
Design, develop, and deploy AI-driven solutions using internal/external data
Fine-tune and monitor LLMs with cutting-edge Python libraries and Azure services
Communicate analytical insights to support strategic decisions
Detect and resolve model/data issues like drift or discrepancies
Help shape GenAI best practices and capability frameworks




What you bring

5+ years in data science with a strong business-oriented mindset
Proven experience with LLM fine-tuning, ML lifecycle, and MLOps
Solid grasp of Python (Pandas, Scikit-learn) and LLM libraries (LangChain, Promptflow, etc.)
Hands-on expertise with Azure AI tools and cloud model deployment (CI/CD, W&B, GitHub)
Strong skills in SQL, Power BI, Databricks




Interested? Apply immediately!




myNEBIRU: Not into this role, but interested in what NEBIRU does? That’s totally fine.

Visit https://nebiru.be/mynebiru to see how we can support you - even outside our client missions. Let’s build the bridge to your next step, together.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Are you passionate about energy, sustainability, and technology, with a drive to create impactful data solutions?

Flexcity, a leading European energy tech company within the Veolia Group is looking for a resourceful Data Scientist to join our Data team.

Job Description

As a Data Scientist, you will be the owner of data assets related to short-term electricity markets, for which Flexcity aims to deliver a best-in-class service. You will carry out quantitative analyses and design optimization solutions using Machine Learning or Linear Programming for our “Smart Grid” services. You will also collaborate with fellow Data Engineers and Developers to deploy these solutions into production.

By interacting with other Flexcity teams, you will gain hands-on experience in developing intelligent systems for both electricity markets (day-ahead, intraday, aFRR, …) and flexible assets (BESS, CHPs, solar parks, …). You will work with cutting-edge and innovative technologies used by Flexcity (Internet of Things, cloud-native development, …) in a fast-moving industry that actively contributes to the energy transition.

As Data Scientist, your time will be divided into:


Research and Development of ML and Optimization Algorithms - 60%
Contribute to all stages of the R&D lifecycle, including design, development, testing, deployment and monitoring of optimization algorithms
Delivering Quantitative Insights to Portfolio Teams - 30%
Use data-driven tools and skills to support colleague portfolio managers in their day-to-day work (market bidding, account management, …)
Data Architecture Improvement - 10%
Actively participate in initiatives to enhance the data stack, DevOps/MLOps practices and coding standards to foster a culture of continuous improvement
Qualifications

Experience


Master’s degree or PhD in Computer Science, Mathematical, Electricity or Energy Engineering, Mathematics or Physics with an excellent academic record
At least 4 years of professional experience working in a quantitative-savvy environment solving complex optimization problems using data


Hard Skills


Fluent in English
Mathematical modeling: Proficient in translating complex real-world systems into rigorous mathematical models
Python development: Proficient in writing Python scripts and building small Python prototypes (with libraries such as pandas, polars, requests, plotly, …)
SQL: Experience in understanding and writing complex SQL queries
Optimization: Experience with either Linear Optimization or Machine Learning methods
Nice to Have - experience with Linux and Git as DevOps tools
Nice to Have - experience with cloud platforms (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure, ...)


Soft Skills


Strong analytical thinking: Independently deconstruct complex quantitative problems and apply a systematic, methodical approach to implement effective solutions
Effective communication skills: Effectively convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, fostering collaboration and understanding across teams
Project management expertise: Organise and prioritise tasks, coordinate cross-functional efforts, and ensure timely delivery of solutions that align with project goals
A positive, pragmatic and professional attitude
Comfortable in a fast changing work environment, you can easily adapt
Nice to Have: an interest for the energy sector


Additional Information

Why Join Flexcity?

Impact Be part of our key Datal team, with a direct impact in the decarbonisation of our industry

Purpose Contribute concretely to a greener future, both in France and globally

Scale-up Work in an agile environment, getting structured and more efficient, but still with a large freedom and strategic decision making available at all levels of the company

Group Benefit from a close relationship with the Veolia group, a global leader in the ecological and energy transformation

Innovation Engage with cutting-edge energy technology and markets

Supported Get backing from dedicated central support teams in R&D, Product and Portfolio, in order to get you the best tools, training and sounding board to work in the best environment

Community Engage with a team spread across multiple countries, learning and innovating together. Connect with diverse teams across Europe through regular team-building events, both within Flexcity and Veolia

Training Develop your hard and soft skills with dedicated training made available, as well as strong learning curve within your position

Hybrid Experience international collaboration and flexible work schedules, including 2 work-from- home days

About Flexcity

Flexcity is a uniquely positioned energy technology company in the Internet of Energy sector. It is a leading demand response aggregator in Europe, rapidly growing and expanding to new regions. Flexcity’s core activity consists of supporting the power grid balance through the operation of its large portfolio of flexible fully-automated assets.

The Flexcity portfolio consists of a wide range of technologies such as batteries, eBoilers, CHPs, generators, wind farms, solar parks and large industrial processes.

As a provider of smart energy management services based on innovative smart grid technology, Flexcity applications focus on demand-side optimization and management (Demand Response, Load Shifting, etc.). Flexcity supports many industrial companies in reducing their overall electricity costs by providing demand-side management services based on innovative optimization and modelling software applications.

Flexcity is truly at the cutting edge of energy innovation. As a member of the team, you will contribute to a sustainable low-carbon energy sector.

As an inclusive company, Veolia is committed to diversity and gives equal consideration to all applications, without discrimination.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Mid/Senior Data Scientist




Location: Remote

Contract Type: 12-Month Contract (Extendable)

Type: Full-time, Contract




The Role

Our client is looking for a highly skilled Senior Data Scientist / ML Engineer to lead the development and deployment of advanced machine learning models.




This is a 100% remote position on a 12-month extendable contract, offering flexibility and the opportunity to work with a global team.




Key Responsibilities

Design and implement AI agent-based architectures for intelligent automation in financial services.
Develop, train, and fine-tune LLMs and other ML models for production-grade performance.
Apply advanced statistical and mathematical modeling to improve predictive accuracy and financial decision-making.
Leverage market and behavioral data to drive innovation in ML applications.
Collaborate with engineering and product teams to integrate ML solutions into the platform.
Build and maintain scalable data pipelines for structured and unstructured data.
Ensure ML systems are efficient, interpretable, and aligned with ethical and regulatory standards.




Requirements

Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
3–5 years of hands-on experience in data science or ML engineering, preferably in fintech or financial services.
Proven experience with LLMs (e.g., GPT, LLaMA) and their deployment in production environments.
Familiarity with AI agents and autonomous systems is a strong plus.
Solid foundation in statistics, optimization, and numerical methods.
Proficiency in Python and ML libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face, and Scikit-Learn.
Knowledge of financial modeling and portfolio optimization is a bonus.
Excellent communication skills in English (Arabic is a plus).




Why Join Us?

Work with cutting-edge AI/ML technologies in a high-impact role.
100% remote work with flexible hours.
Competitive compensation on a contract basis.
Opportunity for contract extension and long-term collaboration.

Title: AI & ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,300 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 18 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

Are you passionate about AI and eager to drive innovation in a fast-paced, impact-driven environment? Do you have experience developing AI-powered applications and enjoy mentoring others? If so, we invite you to join Nexthink as an AI & ML Engineer!

As a key member of our AI team, you will design, develop, and deploy scalable AI solutions, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to enhance digital employee experiences for millions worldwide.

Responsibilities


Lead AI Development – Design and implement AI-powered products, with a strong focus on Agentic systems.
LLMs done right – Create evaluations and define metrics of success using cutting edge AI platforms.
MLOps - Implement and manage MLOps practices to streamline the deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of models and in production environments.
Collaboration & Leadership – Work closely with software engineers, data scientists, and product teams to align AI capabilities with business needs.
Mentorship & Coaching – Guide and support junior AI engineers, fostering a culture of learning and knowledge sharing


Qualifications


BSc/MSc degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Data Science, or a related field.
Hands-on experience in LLM-powered production applications.
Strong proficiency in Python and AI frameworks (e.g., LangChain, PyTorch).
Proven experience with AWS and cloud-based AI deployments.
Solid understanding of AI model fine-tuning, optimization, and evaluation.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning, retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), and multi-agent AI architectures.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs
Familiarity with MLOps best practices for deploying and monitoring AI models in production.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Eagerness to learn and adapt
Strong communication skills in English, capable of explaining complex AI concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders - we believe in learning by sharing.


If you’re excited about pushing the boundaries of AI and mentoring the next generation of engineers, we’d love to hear from you! Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply—we value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:


💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).
📍 Beautiful office with a view of Lake Geneva, conveniently located next to the Prilly-Malley train station
🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.
🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.
🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.
🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.
🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.
🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.
🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!
📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.
🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.


Please note that not all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Junior AI Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Nexthink is the leader in digital employee experience management software. The company provides IT leaders with unprecedented insight allowing them to see, diagnose and fix issues at scale impacting employees anywhere, with any application or network, before employees notice the issue. As the first solution to allow IT to progress from reactive problem solving to proactive optimization, Nexthink enables its more than 1,300 customers to provide better digital experiences to more than 18 million employees. Dual headquartered in Lausanne, Switzerland and Boston, Massachusetts, Nexthink has 9 offices worldwide.

Job Description

We are seeking a Junior AI Engineer with foundational knowledge in AI, GenAI, and Machine Learning. You will join one of our AI teams and assist them in prototyping, maturing, and shipping AI features to a production-ready level.

You are a pragmatic, results-driven engineer who is eager to learn and understands modern AI stacks but thinks in terms of software reliability, performance, and user impact. You focus on creating scalable, observable solutions that solve real-world problems for our customers.

Because the role is cross-functional, the ability to communicate complex concepts in simple ways is essential. You will collaborate with product, design, front-end, and infrastructure teams to bring delightful AI features to life.

Responsibilities

As part of the AI team at Nexthink, you will:


Assist in implementing new AI features with high-quality coding standards and automated test coverage.
Support solving the engineering challenges behind data collection, retrieval, evaluation, and inference at scale.
Help build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for AI components, ensuring safe, repeatable deployments.
Instrument robust online/offline evaluation metrics and dashboards to monitor quality in production.
Proactively propose new product capabilities or improvements based on user data and technology advances.
Stay current with the rapidly evolving AI engineering ecosystem and share knowledge with the Nexthink community.
Communicate effectively with (non-technical) stakeholders such as product managers and UX designers.


Qualifications


BSc/MSc in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field
0-3 years of professional software-engineering experience, including internships or projects.
Basic experience in integrating with LLMs (e.g., Prompting, Evaluation, Observability).
Demonstrated interest in delivering AI-powered features that serve real users at scale (e.g., retrieval-augmented search, Generative AI assistants, predictive analytics).
Fluency in Python or at least one strongly-typed language (TypeScript or Java), with clean-code and testing discipline.
Understanding of cloud-native architectures (AWS or comparable), containerisation (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes / ECS).
Hands-on experience with MLOps: reproducible pipelines, automated evaluations, feature stores, CI/CD for models or prompt/embedding configs.
Strong data intuition: ability to inspect raw logs, design metrics, and quickly identify quality regressions.
Product mindset and empathy for end-users; able to translate fuzzy product requirements into incremental engineering plans.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English (spoken & written).


If you’re excited about joing one of the top companies working on AI and pushing the boundaries of AI we’d love to hear from you! Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply—we value expertise, passion, and the drive to learn.

Additional Information

We are the pioneers and trailblazers of a global IT Market Category (DEX) that is shaping the future of how the world works, giving our customers’ IT Teams total digital visibility across their enterprise. Our innovative solutions integrate real-time analytics, automation, and employee feedback across all endpoints. This enables our IT teams to solve complex technical challenges, create ever more productive workplaces, and deliver happy, satisfied employees in the digital workplace.

With over 1000 employees across 5 continents, Nexthink operates as One Team, connecting, collaborating and innovating to continuously grow. We call our employees ‘Nexthinkers’ and our commitment to diversity, inclusion, and equity is second to none. We currently have over 75 nationalities working with us, from all cultures and backgrounds, speaking many different languages.

If you are looking for a change and like a nice atmosphere, lots of challenges, and having fun while working, this is a great opportunity for you! Check what we offer:

💼 Permanent Contract and a competitive compensation package (including stock options).

📍 Beautiful office with a view of Lake Geneva, conveniently located next to the Prilly-Malley train station

🏡 Hybrid work model balancing office and remote work, with a structured approach for new hires to foster connections and onboarding.

🏖️ Flexible Hours and unlimited vacation (employees have unlimited paid time off on top of the 25 days of holidays we offer) plus 3 company-paid volunteer days.

🤸 Free access to a fitness centre inside the building.

🚞 Reimbursement of the half-fare travel card for public transport.

🧑‍🏫 Reimbursement up to 50% of the cost of French classes.

🍉 Fresh fruit, cookies, and soft drinks as well.

🤝 Regular company and team events like Voluntary Days, Pizza talks, Team Building activities, hosting Meetups at the office and more!

📣 Bonuses for referring successful hires after three months of continuous employment.

🚚 We offer a relocation package to people who are coming from another country.

Please note that NOT all the benefits listed above are available for temporary, contract, and internship roles. To ensure you have the most up-to-date information, we recommend checking with your Recruitment Partner.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
CLEEVEN is a European consulting firm built around two core convictions:

The excellence of European engineers should drive global competitiveness.
Our human mission: to support our consultants in their personal and professional growth.




As part of a strategic data-driven transformation project for a major player in the pharmaceutical industry, we are recruiting a Data Scientist (M/F) to deliver impactful analytics, develop predictive models, and generate actionable insights across R&D, manufacturing, and commercial functions.




🎯 Role and Responsibilities

Collaborate with stakeholders across departments (clinical, regulatory, manufacturing, etc.) to translate business needs into data problems
Design and develop predictive models and statistical analyses to support decision-making in a GxP-compliant environment
Clean, structure, and enrich datasets from multiple sources (internal systems, sensors, third-party databases, etc.)
Apply machine learning and AI techniques (classification, clustering, regression, NLP) to real-world pharmaceutical challenges
Contribute to data product development: build reusable models, pipelines, and visual outputs
Partner with Data Engineers to ensure robust, scalable, and compliant deployment of data science solutions
Communicate results and recommendations clearly to non-technical stakeholders through reports, dashboards, and presentations




🧠 Required Skills

Proven experience as a Data Scientist, ideally in a regulated or scientific environment
Solid knowledge of machine learning, statistics, and data wrangling techniques
Proficiency in Python (pandas, scikit-learn, numpy, etc.), and tools like Jupyter, MLflow or similar
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI, Tableau, or Plotly Dash)
Good understanding of data governance and compliance in pharma (GxP, ALCOA+, FAIR principles) is a strong plus
Familiarity with pharma-specific domains like clinical trials, manufacturing processes, or real-world evidence is appreciated
Strong communication skills and ability to work cross-functionally




👤 Profile

Master's degree or PhD in Data Science, Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Statistics, or a related field
Minimum 2 years of experience in applied data science
Curious, rigorous, business-oriented, and able to explain complex models in simple terms
Fluent in English; German or French is a plus




See you soon,

Title: Machine Learning / AI Engineer (f/m/x) 60-100%
Description:
About Us

comparis.ch is the leading comparison platform in Switzerland. We have been comparing the prices and products of health insurers, other insurance companies, telecom providers and banks for over 25 years and offer the largest Swiss online marketplace for cars and property. Our comprehensive comparisons ensure transparency for our users and help them make the right decisions. With over 80 million visits each year, we rank among the most widely used websites in Switzerland. Four out of five people recognize us as THE independent comparison platform in Switzerland. And now, with the corporate introduction out of the way, we'll get to the point: we need you!

What You Will Do

We’re looking for an open and passionate individual to join us in pursuit of great new AI tools that help our users make better decisions. As a Machine Learning / AI Engineer, you will help building and changing the future. You will have the opportunity to challenge ideas, contribute with your own ideas, and ideally support the development of new solutions. Additionally, you will have the chance to refine Generative models and play a role in shaping the adoption of AI tools across the company. Your impactful work will help empower Swiss consumers in making better decisions.

In Detail, You Will Be Responsible For


Development of machine learning models and tools, with a focus on Generative AI as well as other areas. This will involve working on various use cases and helping to implement and improve machine learning algorithms, tools and enhancements of our current product landscape.
Contributing to the creation of training datasets by performing exploratory analysis, selecting and preparing the data for machine learning purposes. This will involve cleaning and organising the data to ensure its quality and suitability for model training. As well as building tools, agents and other cool stuff in the given area.


What We Expect From You


Creativity and curiosity for data-driven innovation, generative AI, ML in general and the like in an online environment. Ability to apply data modelling, statistics and machine-learning to delight our users and solve business problems in the fields of personal finances and marketplaces.
More than 4 years of experience in Data Science and Engineering skills.
Deep understanding in at least one programming language (e.g. Python, Scala, Java).
At least 2 years experience and deep understanding in working with foundation models (e.g. LLMs, multimodal models). Practical experience with tools like Python scikit-learn, LLMs deployment, fine-tuning, openAI Platform or others.
Fluent in English, German is a plus.


In return, here is what you can expect from us

At Comparis, we believe that empowered employees deliver the best results. We cultivate a culture of transparency, mutual respect and trust. Firm believers in lifelong learning, we are always trying out new things and continuously developing – both as individuals and as a team. We also offer flat hierarchies, considerable autonomy and creative freedom, as well as a skilled and motivated team that will advise and support you in your work and make it easy for you to push your own boundaries. Finally, we offer flexible working hours to work from wherever you are and live.

Have we triggered your interest?

Then don't hesitate and apply for our position today. If you have any questions, Simone, our People Business Partner, will be happy to help. We look forward to receiving your application!

Note: This is an on-site role.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About the Role




Cleeven is seeking a talented and driven Data Scientist to join our Swiss consulting team. In this role, you will support our clients across various industries—such as finance, healthcare, energy, and manufacturing—by transforming data into actionable insights that drive innovation and efficiency.




As a Data Scientist, you will work closely with business stakeholders and technical teams to identify problems, develop data-driven solutions, and deploy predictive and prescriptive models in real-world environments. You will be exposed to a wide range of challenges, from customer analytics and process optimization to forecasting, anomaly detection, and NLP.







Responsibilities




Understand client challenges and translate them into data science use cases and solutions.
Explore, clean, and analyze large and complex data sets using statistical and machine learning techniques.
Build, test, and deploy predictive models and data products using modern data science tools and frameworks.
Communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical audiences through visualizations, dashboards, and reports.
Collaborate with data engineers and domain experts to ensure models are scalable, maintainable, and integrated into production environments.
Stay up to date with emerging technologies and methodologies in the field of AI and data science.
Document methodologies, experiments, and code to ensure transparency and reproducibility.







Required Qualifications




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
Proficiency in Python or R, and strong experience with libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
Solid knowledge of statistical modeling, machine learning, and data visualization.
Experience working with SQL and data stored in relational databases or data lakes.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git).
Fluent in German and English (C1 level or higher).
Willingness to travel and work on-site at client locations throughout Switzerland.







Key Competencies




Strong problem-solving skills with a curious and analytical mindset.
Ability to communicate technical concepts in a clear and engaging way.
Experience working in cross-functional teams with business and technical stakeholders.
Focused on value creation and real-world impact.
Organized, detail-oriented, and proactive.

Show more

In this role, you will support our clients across various industries—such as finance, healthcare, energy, and manufacturing—by transforming data into actionable insights that drive innovation and efficiency.


As a Data Scientist, you will work closely with business stakeholders and technical teams to identify problems, develop data-driven solutions, and deploy predictive and prescriptive models in real-world environments. You will be exposed to a wide range of challenges, from customer analytics and process optimization to forecasting, anomaly detection, and NLP.



Responsibilities


  • Understand client challenges and translate them into data science use cases and solutions.
  • Explore, clean, and analyze large and complex data sets using statistical and machine learning techniques.
  • Build, test, and deploy predictive models and data products using modern data science tools and frameworks.
  • Communicate findings clearly to technical and non-technical audiences through visualizations, dashboards, and reports.
  • Collaborate with data engineers and domain experts to ensure models are scalable, maintainable, and integrated into production environments.
  • Stay up to date with emerging technologies and methodologies in the field of AI and data science.
  • Document methodologies, experiments, and code to ensure transparency and reproducibility.



Required Qualifications


  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in Python or R, and strong experience with libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar.
  • Solid knowledge of statistical modeling, machine learning, and data visualization.
  • Experience working with SQL and data stored in relational databases or data lakes.
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP) and version control systems (e.g., Git).
  • Fluent in German and English (C1 level or higher).
  • Willingness to travel and work on-site at client locations throughout Switzerland.



Key Competencies


  • Strong problem-solving skills with a curious and analytical mindset.
  • Ability to communicate technical concepts in a clear and engaging way.
  • Experience working in cross-functional teams with business and technical stakeholders.
  • Focused on value creation and real-world impact.
  • Organized, detail-oriented, and proactive.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer

DevOps and automated deployment practices

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Scientist Location: Basel
Duration: 6 months (extension possible)
Start Date: ASAP 
Workload: 100%
Department: Monetary and Economic Department (MED)
Unit: Departmental Research Support (DRS)

Job Summary: We are seeking a motivated Junior Data Scientist to support the preparation and management of economic and financial market data. You will clean, organize, and standardize datasets from diverse sources and implement quality control procedures to ensure data accuracy. These datasets will support economists and researchers in achieving research objectives.

Key Responsibilities:
Clean, organize, and standardize data from multiple sources.


Prepare high-quality, analysis-ready datasets for internal use.


Apply quality control checks to maintain data consistency and accuracy.


Align data processing and interpretation with specific research goals.


Required Qualifications & Skills:
Solid foundation in data science (internship or entry-level experience acceptable).


Proficiency in Python and Matlab.


Strong understanding of statistical tools and techniques.


Basic knowledge of economics and financial markets.


Interpersonal Skills:
Strong attention to detail.


Effective problem-solving ability.


Collaborative mindset with experience working in cross-functional teams.


Proactive and self-motivated.


Nice to Have:
Experience with additional programming languages/tools.


Exposure to advanced data visualization techniques.


Familiarity with machine learning concepts.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Sigma Suisse is seeking for it's client, a company in the trading sector, a Data Scientist with experience in the physical world : commodity industry, transportation or logistics :




We are seeking a skilled professional to join our client's team specializing in data science and machine learning. This role involves collaboration with various departments, including technical experts, software developers, and business teams, to develop and implement advanced analytical models and applications.




The position spans multiple areas such as trading, operational processes, and other supporting functions, requiring adaptability to diverse technologies and stakeholder needs. The selected candidate will be involved in every stage of project development, from defining objectives with stakeholders to data preparation, exploratory analysis, model optimization, and deployment of production-ready solutions.




This role demands a hands-on approach to handling complex datasets and delivering actionable insights. The candidate will join a group of experienced professionals focused on addressing significant challenges within the energy sector while exploring innovative possibilities for improvement.




Job Description




Apply data science to development applications in the commodities trading sector
Design and implement optimization, improvement, and automation solutions for trading applications
Analyze data related to physical movements (vessel locations, etc.) in the commodities industry
Develop models and analyses to extract insights from physical world data
Collaborate closely with the software development team to create clean and modular code
Participate in the continuous improvement of existing trading applications




Qualifications




Degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or related field
5 to 10 years of experience in data science, ideally in the commodities sector
Strong skills in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning
Advanced proficiency in Python and ability to write clean, modular, and well-documented code
Proven experience analyzing data related to the physical world (transportation, logistics, etc.)
Ability to translate complex problems into effective technical solutions
Knowledge of the commodities sector and trading applications is a significant advantage
Experience in C# development appreciated but not mandatory

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Company Description

Vitol is a leader in energy and commodities. Vitol produces, manages and delivers energy and commodities to consumers and industry worldwide. In addition to its primary business of trading, Vitol is invested in infrastructure globally, with $10+billion invested in long-term assets.

Vitol’s customers include national oil companies, multinationals, leading industrial companies and utilities. Founded in Rotterdam in 1966, today Vitol serves its customers from some 40 offices worldwide. Revenues in 2023 were $400bn.

For more information: vitol.com

Job Description

As our portfolio of work continues to grow, we are looking for an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to join our data science and machine learning team. The individual will work closely with the data and machine learning specialists, software engineers and commercial teams to deliver machine learning models and applications.

We work across the trading business, operations, and other support functions; so the individual will need to be comfortable working with a variety of stakeholders and technologies.

The Machine Learning Engineer at Vitol has visibility and impact across the full project workflow: from working with business stakeholders to help define the project, to data collation and processing, exploratory analysis, model selection and tuning, and implementation of production models.

The successful candidate will join a team of experienced, collaborative practitioners, who are (pragmatically) solving some of the most challenging and impactful problems the energy industry is facing; as well as pushing the boundaries around the ‘art of the possible’.

Core Responsibilities Include


Being an energetic and enthusiastic member of a team uniquely positioned to bring the power of data to bear on the inner workings of the energy industry
Leading design, development, and deployment of machine learning systems, bringing their technical knowledge and experience into the team, and using this to create real solutions to real problems
Collaborating with cross-functional technology teams to gather requirements and ensure the solutions align with business objectives
Helping integrate the team’s solutions (including generative AI) into existing systems and platforms to provide seamless user experiences and scale adoption
Actively participating in code reviews, experiment design and tooling decisions to help drive the team’s velocity and quality
Helping build data and machine learning expertise within the business through knowledge sharing


Qualifications


Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field. Ph.D. is a plus
Fluency in Python with the ability to write clean, modular, well-documented code as well as a solid understanding of coding best practices
3-5+ years in industry developing and deploying machine learning models
Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Transformers
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS) and containerization technologies (Docker)
Excellent problem-solving skills, ability to work independently and in a team
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Understanding of machine learning fundamentals, including deep learning, generative models, NLP techniques, etc.


Desired Experience


Experience in the energy or commodities trading industry, with knowledge of financial markets and trading concepts
Experience integrating machine learning systems into interactive dashboards (e.g. Dash, Streamlit) and present use cases of machine learning to non-technical colleagues
Time series modelling (both machine-learning and econometric approaches)
Application of a wide range of ML methodologies to real life applications
Enterprise software development (systems design, code review, version control, etc.)
Data orchestrators (Airflow, Dagster) and cloud-based ETL/ELT pipelines
Awareness of continuous integration and delivery concepts/technologies


Additional Information

Personal Characteristics


A self-motivated individual who thrives on seeing the results of their work make an impact in the business
Strong communication skills, both verbally and in writing
Proven ability to be flexible, work hard, and a sense for the art of the possible
Methodical, organized and with an attention to detail - in general, in experimental design, and in code!
Willingness to share their knowledge and learn from others
An interest in learning about the commodities space
Resourceful, able to think creatively and adapt in a dynamic environment
Team player, with an open non-political style and a high level of integrity
Desire to be a thought-partner in a fast-growing team, and make an impact at a business that sits at the heart of the world’s energy flows


What We Offer


Competitive salary and benefits package
Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
Close collaboration with various business units across our key regions (eg. London, Singapore, Houston, Geneva)
A highly motivated DS and ML team comprised of experienced individuals with a supportive attitude and great team spirit
Being part of the energy transition through increased emphasis on renewable & alternative energy sources at a pivotal moment in the industry
Strong management commitment to incorporating machine learning into the future of Vitol’s operations
Show more

  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • Large diversity of projects with real-world impacts on a truly global scale
  • Entrepreneurial environment within a flat hierarchy, where great ideas come to life quickly
  • Close collaboration with various business units across our key regions (eg. London, Singapore, Houston, Geneva)
  • A highly motivated DS and ML team comprised of experienced individuals with a supportive attitude and great team spirit
  • Being part of the energy transition through increased emphasis on renewable & alternative energy sources at a pivotal moment in the industry
  • Strong management commitment to incorporating machine learning into the future of Vitol’s operations

Title: Optimization Data Scientist
Description:
Contexte et environnement

Your mission

As part of the Optimization Services team, you will design, develop, deploy and support the Data Science models of the team’s systems/applications.

The Optimization Services team focuses on the multi-market multi-asset optimizations of short-term power trading. We are part of the Gas & Power IT department for the Trading business lines of the TotalEnergies company, whose main office is in Geneva with a presence on other continents (Singapore, Houston, Dubaï, etc.).

TotalEnergies Gas & Power Trading (TGP) and its affiliates has a large and complex systems environment, which is evolving with the expansion of the power trading business and its impact on trading IT. To accompany these evolutions, the Optimization Services team participates in a significant change program that will have notable impacts both on the short-term and the long-term. In this context, the team is leveraging Data Science and Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP.

This role is global and focuses on the tools used by the front office and the integration into the overall energy management systems. The continuation of the systems performance, availability, and resilience, as well as scalability, need to be assured.

Activités

What You Will Do

Your focus will be on the Data Science models of the Optimization Service’s team applications. A significant part of these models will be based on Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP. You will interact mainly with the team’s Business Analysts, Data Scientists and Back-end Developers.

Analyze:


Understand the business context and specifications
Analyze the technical and functional feasibility
Participate in the design authority processes



Produce:


Design, develop and deploy new functionalities according to business needs
Ensure the proper functioning of the deliverable through monitoring and testing
Ensure the models are seamlessly integrated in the related applications
Implement the adequate balance between model precision and computation complexity
Adjust the deliverables based on feedback
Ensure adherence to best practice, guidelines and procedures for development, test and deployment
Maintain compliance of development and related activities with audit, cybersecurity and other internal requirements



Run & Change:


Improve the existing applications based on business needs and priorities
Participate in the support of the existing applications



Communicate:


Collaborate with Back-end Developers to integrate features and ensure interoperability
Provide technical support and assistance to Business Analysts and other contributors for specifications, testing and the resolution of incidents / problems
Document the codes as well as the algorithms to facilitate maintenance and knowledge transfer
Ensure and maintain effective interactions with other relevant teams
Contribute to the community of Data Scientists



Profil du candidat

We expect you to have:


A Data Scientist / Optimization Expert background with a proficiency in software development
Knowledge and experience in Mathematical Constrained Optimization, in particular MILP
Proficiency in Python and its good practices
Interest for the power trading business
An ability to quickly understand the physical mechanisms for power assets (e.g.: how a battery works)
Educated to at least Masters degree level or an equivalent in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a similar discipline



It would be a plus if you had:


Knowledge of data and analytics, including AI/ML technologies, and their application for the power trading business
Experience in Agile methodologies and project management methodologies
Experience in a power utility or trading environment
Good skills on DevOps (Docker, Git, GitHub Actions)
Good knowledge of noSQL databases (MongoDB)
Experience with Databricks
Experience in Cloud-based environments



Your strengths

You are…


Able to solve complex problems
Rigorous
A Team player
Curious and open-minded
Dynamic and agile
Able to shift from detail-oriented to big-picture views



Languages


English : C1 level as minimum expectation
Competency in French is advantageous



Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Experimental Research Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Company Description

As a world market leader in crop protection, we help farmers to counter these threats and ensure enough safe, nutritious, affordable food for all – while minimizing the use of land and other agricultural inputs. Syngenta Crop Protection keeps plants safe from planting to harvesting. From the moment a seed is planted through to harvest, crops need to be protected from weeds, insects and diseases as well as droughts and floods, heat and cold. Syngenta Crop Protection is headquartered in Switzerland.

Health Promotion Switzerland recognizes Syngenta's commitment to the health and well-being of its employees and awards the "Friendly Work Space" label to all its Swiss sites. At Syngenta, employee health and well-being are key to the company.

Job Description

Role purpose:

As an Experimental Research Scientist you will be responsible for driving research from discovery to development by delivering target molecules in an efficient, safe and sustainable way.

Accountabilities


Synthesis: Executing synthetic routes safely and sustainably, partnering with key support platforms to maximize efficiency
HSE: Carrying out detailed risk assessment of experimental procedures and raw materials in line with Syngenta HSE standards
Documentation: Documenting and communicating experimental procedures and data with the highest scientific accuracy and sufficient observational details to enable easy reproduction, retrieval, digital integration, and secure IP
Problem solving: Collaborative problem solving and troubleshooting of synthetic chemistry
Knowledge: Building knowledge and expertise in modern synthetic methods and technologies through continuous personal development


Qualifications


Full training through an internal Syngenta apprenticeship program
Proficiency in synthetic organic chemistry, including reaction design, purification, and troubleshooting, all with high standards of HSE
Collaborative and self-motivated character: working effectively within teams and with some autonomy
Proficiency in English


Additional Information

We offer a variety of financial and non-financial benefits including:


We offer a position which contributes to valuable and impactful work in a stimulating and international environment
A superb working environment with an open culture and diverse workforce where new ideas are always welcome
The opportunity to work with and learn from highly qualified and experienced employees and gain scientific and technical excellence
Learning culture (Together we Grow) and wide range of training options
You will profit from a competitive pension fund plan, attractive bonus system, onsite doctor, fitness room, canteen, and other benefits (Family friendly initiatives, Child and Family allowance…)


Please send your complete application with CV, motivation letter, diploma and work certificates

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status

Title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have


Continuous learning Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package, which includes medical, dental, mental health, and vision coverage for you, your spouse/partner, and children.


Your Impact

As a Data Scientist at QuantumBlack, you will work in multi-disciplinary environments harnessing data to provide real-world impact for organizations globally. You will influence many of the recommendations our clients need to positively change their businesses and enhance performance.

Role Responsibilities


Working on complex and extremely varied data sets from some of the world’s largest organizations to solve real world problems
Developing high quality data science products and solutions for clients as well as assets for our internal data teams
Focusing on modelling, working alongside the Data Engineering team
Presenting findings, recommendations and providing consultation to stakeholders (internal and clients)


What You’ll Learn


Work across various industries and sectors, gaining insights into diverse business challenges and applications of data science
Build large-scale data & analytics solutions, handling complex problems and advanced client situations
Best practices in data & analytics development including framework, responsibility model, high quality code, data security, sustainability and scalability
Work in collaborative teams with diverse skill sets, fostering effective teamwork and learning from colleagues in a multicultural and creative environment
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data science tools, techniques, and technologies as well as first class learning programs
Develop strong client-facing skills, including effective communication, problem-solving, and presentation abilities


You will work with other data scientists, data/ML engineers, designers, project managers and business subject matter experts on interdisciplinary projects across various industry sectors to enable business ambitions with data & analytics.

Who You Are

You are a highly collaborative individual who is capable of laying aside your own agenda, listening to and learning from colleagues, challenging thoughtfully and prioritizing impact. You search for ways to improve things and work collaboratively with colleagues. You believe in iterative change, experimenting with new approaches, learning and improving to move forward quickly.

Our Tech Stack

While we advocate for using the right tools for the right task, we also take into account client’s current landscape and preferences. Often, we use Python, PySpark, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Databricks, SQL, Docker and Kubernetes. We also leverage our own proprietary tools such as Kedro, CuasalNex, MLRun (check out more OSS here https //www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/quantumblack/labs). We work on regular basis with cloud service providers such as AWS, GCP and Azure.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Degree in (business) math, statistics, machine learning, data science, physics, computer science or engineering required
Master's degree or PhD level in the field of data science, computer science, business informatics or equivalent is a plus
Up to 2 years of professional hands-on experience in applying advanced data science methods and implementing technical data solutions (e.g. develop machine learning models), in order to solve business problems
A strong grasp of various analytics landscape, including business intelligence, machine learning, AI, and generative AI, and how to apply them effectively in different scenarios
Proficiency in Python, SQL (focus on data & analytics applications)
Professional experience in cloud-based analytical tools from market-leading providers such as AWS, MS Azure, Google Cloud
Proficient communication skills in German and English
Effective communication and presentation skills, particularly the ability to explain complex analytical concepts in a comprehensible manner adapted to different groups of non-technical audiences e.g. business managers, heads of products, sales & marketing leads
Practical experience in generative AI application development
Proven record of advisory works
Proven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activities
Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (Zürich)
Description:
Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer

Type: Permanent contract

Location: Switzerland (Lausanne or Zurich)

About Us

At Visium, we enable enterprise executives in defining their AI & Data strategy, executing large scale transformations and implementing AI across operations, ensuring their organization becomes future-proof.

With expertise in strategy, architecture, cloud engineering, analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, we empower our clients to unleash and scale the power of their data.

We're on a mission to pioneer a bright future and build future-proof and ethical organizations. Join the curious, the ambitious, the doers, the good-hearted, the ones who build a world we're all in awe of - our Visumees.

Ready to become one?

Role

As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, you will assume a technical leadership role in designing, implementing and deploying innovative solutions with tangible business impact. Join our growing team and contribute to our expansion in Switzerland and internationally

Coupling state-of-the-art Machine Learning techniques with best practices in Software Engineering you will build robust and scalable applications that empower our clients to drive meaningful value from their data. You are passionate about understanding client needs to drive top-notch customer experience and adoption. Finally, you are meticulously organized and prepared to work in a fast-paced and dynamic team environment.

Requirements

Embark on a rewarding journey where you


Proactively take ownership of projects, making decisions and ensuring successful outcomes
Embrace challenges as opportunities to learn, actively seeking and sharing feedback to expand your skills
Exhibit genuine empathy, understanding diverse perspectives and fostering a collaborative and team-oriented atmosphere
Have strong communication skills and the ability to present insights to non-technical and technical stakeholders in an accessible way


In addition, this should be part of your background to apply


4+ years of professional experience as a Machine Learning or Data Scientist or in a relevant role
Experience with ML/DL frameworks and tools in Python (e.g., Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, huggingface/transformers)
Proficiency in Software Development best practices (e.g., Object-Oriented Programming, Design Patterns, Agile Methodology)
Experience in applying deep learning approaches, such as recurrent and convolutional neural networks and transformer models
Experience with MLOps best practices and tools (e.g., dvc, MLFlow, tfX, Kubeflow)
Experience developing and deploying ML solutions using Cloud services (e.g., AWS Sagemaker, GCP Vertex.AI, Azure ML)
Familiarity with REST API and microservices


The following are a plus


Experience with Data and AI platforms (Databricks, Dataiku, Snowflake) or an associated Data Engineer certification
Experience working in a client-facing or consulting role
Familiarity with Generative AI models & tools (e.g., langchain, OpenAI API, LLama2)
Familiarity with web development (e.g., Next.js, React, FastAPI, Flask)


Benefits

What we offer


A competitive compensation package
A yearly education budget to steep your learning curve
A yearly sport budget because a fit body leads to a fit mind
A flexible working culture because your work-life balance matters to us
A position that enables you to have an impact on 1'000s of people, and the whole company's growth
An international, knowledgeable, and passionate team with a strong collaborative mindset


Check our LinkedIn and website to learn more about us & don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning – Data Engineer
Description:
Contexte et environnement

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Activités

The Predictive Department provides machine learning signals of significant added value for the various trading desks, aiding in the overall efficiency of the energy transition. It will become the Center of competence for Data science / ML for Gas & Power Trading.

As a Machine Learning – Data engineer, you will play a key role in supporting the expansion of TotalEnergies' gas and power business by enhancing data capabilities for trading and risk management. You will also contribute to data product life cycle serving trends across all commodities traded by TGP, including global gas, electricity, emissions, LNG, Freight, and more.

The role involves working on a significant change program aligned with TotalEnergies’ transition to renewable power.

The ML - Data Engineer will be instrumental in designing, implementing, and maintaining robust data pipelines and cloud architectures that enable advanced analytics and trading strategies. The ideal candidate will have expertise in AWS, Databricks, DevOps automation, and large-scale data processing.

You will find below your key responsibilities:


Develop and optimize data pipelines: Build, maintain, and optimize ETL processes using AWS Fargate, Lambda, S3, Mongo and Databricks to ensure high data quality and timely availability.
Infrastructure and Cloud Engineering: Design and manage cloud-based data solutions to support high-performance analytics and trading operations.
Feature Engineering and Data Processing: Develop golden datasets and features with ML models and forecasting algorithms.
DevOps & CI/CD Automation: Automate deployment workflows using Terraform, GitHub Actions.
Data Governance & Security: Ensure compliance with industry best practices, including data security, quality assurance, and reliability.
API Integration: Discover and integrate external data sources through API development and management.
Collaboration & Business Support: Work closely with business users to ensure data solutions align with trading and optimization needs.



Profil du candidat


You hold a Ph.D. or Master’s degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field.
You have 6+ years of experience in data engineering, cloud architecture, and DevOps.
You have a strong expertise in Expertise in AWS services (Lambda, Fargate, S3), and proficiency in Python, Mongo, Spark, and experience with Databricks.
You also have a strong experience in CI/CD automation using Terraform, GitHub Actions.
You already show knowledge of API integration and working with structured/unstructured data sources.
Previous working experience with time-series analysis and forecasting is a plus.
Fluent in English (oral and written) – knowledge of French is an advantage.
The position requires strong problem-solving skills, clear communication, and ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams.



Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.
Show more

Title: Research Engineer
Description:
At Visium, we enable enterprise executives in defining their AI & Data strategy, execute large scale transformations and implement AI across operations, ensuring their organization becomes future-proof.

With expertise in strategy, architecture, cloud engineering, analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, we empower our clients to unleash and scale the power of their data.

We're on a mission to pioneer a bright future and build future-proof and ethical organizations . Join the curious, the ambitious, the doers, the good-hearted, the ones who build a world we're all in awe of - our Visumees.

Ready to become one?

Requirements

You will collaborate closely with researchers and engineers to implement and optimize systems that support the development and deployment of state-of-the-art AI solutions. This role is ideal for individuals who thrive at the intersection of research and engineering, particularly in building robust tooling and data pipelines for large-scale AI models such as LLMs.

Key Responsibilities:


Data Engineering: Build and maintain robust data pipelines that handle diverse and large-scale datasets, ensuring data quality and accessibility for model training
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, ML engineers, and product managers, to integrate AI solutions into real-world applications
Research Support: Support Data Science needs, run large-scale model training, and analyze results to support ongoing research initiatives


Tooling and Automation: Develop tools and automation scripts to streamline workflows, improve efficiency, and ensure reproducibility in research and development processes.

Requirements

You bring technical strength, curiosity, and a drive to build meaningful AI systems. Here's what helps you succeed in this role:


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. A Ph.D. is a plus
Proficiency in Python
Solid understanding of machine learning concepts and experience working with ML frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or JAX
Experience with large language models (LLMs) and understanding of their training and deployment challenges
Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment of ML models
Experience in deploying distributed systems, cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure), and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)
Strong skills in data processing, ETL pipelines, and working with large-scale datasets
Ability to tackle complex problems, think critically, and develop innovative solutions
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences


We know that great candidates might not check every box. If you're excited about this role and believe you could contribute, we'd love to hear from you.

Benefits

What we offer


A competitive compensation package
A yearly education budget to steep your learning curve
A yearly sport budget because a fit body leads to a fit mind
A flexible working culture because your work-life balance matters to us
A position that enables you to have an impact on 1'000s of people, and the whole company's growth
An international, knowledgeable, and passionate team with a strong collaborative mindset


Check our LinkedIn and website to learn more about us & don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
On behalf of our client Hilo by Aktiia, and as part of an exclusive mandate, we are seeking a versatile and motivated individual to join their pioneering team as a




MACHINE LEARING ENGINEER 100%




Company Overview

Hilo by Aktiia believes, the key to improving cardiovascular health is to provide patients and physicians with a deeper understanding of the blood pressure pattern. Before Hilo, it was not possible to monitor cardiovascular health at scale.

They are an early-stage, venture-backed start-up that has raised over $96M from top-tier investors in Europe and the United States. They have developed and brought to market the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor. Their technology is based on 18 years of research by their founders at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Hilo by Aktiia's solution has been validated through extensive clinical trials and received a CE Mark as a Class IIa medical device under MDR leading to commercial access of approximately 43 countries worldwide.







Responsibilities

Design, develop, optimize, and document innovative AI models for blood pressure estimation from optical signals
Analyze model limitations and devise strategies to enhance performance, addressing key challenges
Collaborate and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to solve complex technical problems




Your profile

M.Sc or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or a relevant field
2+ years of industry experience applying Deep Learning techniques, ideally in a highly regulated field (medtech, banking, …)
Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and evaluating neural network architectures on large-scale datasets
Experience in performing verification and validation (V&V) activities of developed models
Experience in deploying machine learning models in a production environment
Deep understanding of statistical learning, CNNs, and RNNs
Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.) + AWS
Experience in medical signal processing or time series analysis is a plus
Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
Creative and hands-on approach to problem-solving
Comfortable working in a multidisciplinary, multicultural, and diversity-oriented team
Highly organized and meticulous in code development and documentation, ensuring thorough traceability and clarity in compliance with medical device industry standards
Based in Switzerland, with a valid Swiss work permit




Benefits

Pension
Competitive compensation package based on experience
Flexible work location (hybrid work schedule)







Are you passionate in solving problems with visionaries and innovative approaches?




Then Flurin Schwager looks forward to receiving your application documents or your call.

Show more
