MACHINE LEARING ENGINEER 100%


Company Overview

Hilo by Aktiia believes, the key to improving cardiovascular health is to provide patients and physicians with a deeper understanding of the blood pressure pattern. Before Hilo, it was not possible to monitor cardiovascular health at scale.

They are an early-stage, venture-backed start-up that has raised over $96M from top-tier investors in Europe and the United States. They have developed and brought to market the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor. Their technology is based on 18 years of research by their founders at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Hilo by Aktiia's solution has been validated through extensive clinical trials and received a CE Mark as a Class IIa medical device under MDR leading to commercial access of approximately 43 countries worldwide.



Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, optimize, and document innovative AI models for blood pressure estimation from optical signals
  • Analyze model limitations and devise strategies to enhance performance, addressing key challenges
  • Collaborate and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams to solve complex technical problems


Your profile

  • M.Sc or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or a relevant field
  • 2+ years of industry experience applying Deep Learning techniques, ideally in a highly regulated field (medtech, banking, …)
  • Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and evaluating neural network architectures on large-scale datasets
  • Experience in performing verification and validation (V&V) activities of developed models
  • Experience in deploying machine learning models in a production environment
  • Deep understanding of statistical learning, CNNs, and RNNs
  • Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.) + AWS
  • Experience in medical signal processing or time series analysis is a plus
  • Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
  • Creative and hands-on approach to problem-solving
  • Comfortable working in a multidisciplinary, multicultural, and diversity-oriented team
  • Highly organized and meticulous in code development and documentation, ensuring thorough traceability and clarity in compliance with medical device industry standards
  • Based in Switzerland, with a valid Swiss work permit


Benefits

  • Pension
  • Competitive compensation package based on experience
  • Flexible work location (hybrid work schedule)



Are you passionate in solving problems with visionaries and innovative approaches?


Then Flurin Schwager looks forward to receiving your application documents or your call.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (OSS) in a fast-growing AI Startup
Description:
At the ETH spin-off Lightly, we build software solutions to help companies improve their deep learning models. The available data for deep learning grows faster than human tagging and available compute power. Our customers already face this problem and have too much data to process. As a solution, we built software to identify and work with the most relevant samples only. Learn more about us on our website.




We are a team of talented developers and researchers in Zurich, Prague and San Francisco and are backed by YCombinator. Every member of the team is going to have a massive impact.




Thus, we are looking for an experienced engineer with lots of passion for the subject. We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




We use a modern stack of:





PyTorch, Python, Typescript, C++, Rust, React, NodeJS


Docker, Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, AWS



Tasks


As a Machine Learning Engineer in the core ML team, you will be part of a team which works mainly on our open-source package for self-supervised learning and similar internal frameworks.




Particularly, you will get to:





Work on our open-source Python package for self-supervised learning: https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Add support for finetuning pretrained models for downstream tasks including many different computer vision tasks like object detection, segmentation, tracking, and more.


Keep up with current research in self-supervised learning and multi-modal models.


All these tasks will include working with state-of-the-art technology such as self-supervised learning, model distillation, vision language models and deep learning for computer vision in general.


Participate in and hold paper sessions about the latest papers in the field.


Represent the company at machine learning conferences and engage with the community.





In general, for this role expect to use the stack we use for our open-source package https://github.com/lightly-ai/lightly.


Requirements


Ideally, you have:





MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field


Experience in deep learning and computer vision, ideally in self-supervised learning and you have worked with PyTorch.


Excellent Python coding skills and knowledge of software engineering best practices. Experience with testing and typed Python is a big plus.


Experience with building and shipping software solutions.


Strong passion for new technologies and interest in keeping up with the latest technologies and publications in deep learning.



Benefits


We offer attractive cash- & equity package for you to become part-owner of Lightly. Remote work is also possible.




Interested? Contact us!




We look forward to getting to know you!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
60-80%

The Institute of Tissue Medicine and Pathology (ITMP) is an institution of the University of Bern, Switzerland with three major tasks: teaching, research and diagnostic service. In total, there are around 220 employees at the Institute. The ITMP provides an attractive setting to perform cutting-edge translational research in direct collaboration with pathologists and oncologists treating patients.

As of September 2025 or by arrangement, the directorate and TRU/TBB Division of ITMP is seeking a Data Scientist 60-80%.

Job Description

You support tissue based and clinical (human tissue-based) research approaches of the ITMP, in collaboration with the Insel data science centre (IDSC). You work on the scientific data platforms of the IDSC and ITMP, collaborating with our researchers. We are looking for a highly motivated data scientist interested in understanding research questions and capable of querying the data lakes of the IDSC. Experience in working with sensitive data as well as with large language models are of ad-vantage. You are responsible for the development of our in-house research data-base. In the ITMP, you collaborate with our research bio-informaticians and our ICT–team.

Requirements

You have completed training as data scientist. You have experience in management of both clinical as well as in experimental data. You have good knowledge of databases. Previous experience with patient data is a plus. You are a team player, act responsibly, work independently, and with your own initiative to develop new techniques and projects. You are flexible, enjoy your work and value the interactions in a diverse, young team. You enjoy new things and building internal structures. Good knowledge of English is required.

Application

Please send your application by e-mail to sandra.wittwer@unibe.ch by July 15, 2025. Applications should include a short letter of interest, curriculum vitae with description of your professional experience, a list of 2 references and copies of the certificates of academic qualifications.

For more information, please contact Prof. Aurel Perren (Phone +41 31 684 11 30,

e-mail aurel.perren@unibe.ch).

www.karriere.unibe.ch Rechtliche Hinweise

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Junior Data Scientist to support economic/financial market data management processes. The role involves preparing ready-for-use datasets for economists and researchers by cleaning, organising, and standardising data from diverse sources. The candidate will also implement quality control measures to ensure data accuracy and consistency. Perfect candidate: The ideal candidate has a strong foundation in data science, proficiency in Python and Matlab, and familiarity with statistical tools and techniques. They possess a solid understanding of economics and financial markets to align data management with research objectives. Additionally, they demonstrate attention to detail, problem-solving skills, and the ability to work collaboratively in a multidisciplinary environment.

Tasks & Responsibilities:


Clean, organise, and standardise data from diverse sources.
Prepare ready-for-use datasets for economists and researchers.
Implement quality control measures to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Interpret and manage data in alignment with research objectives.


Must haves:


Strong foundation in data science as a Data Scientist/Research Analyst.
Proficiency in Python and Matlab
Familiarity with statistical tools and techniques
Solid understanding of economics and financial markets


Interpersonal skills:


Attention to detail.
Good problem-solving skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a multidisciplinary environment.
Ability to take initiative.


Nice to have:


Experience with additional programming languages or tools.
Exposure to advanced data visualisation techniques.
Familiarity with machine learning concepts.




Job Title: Junior Data Scientist

Location: Basel, Switzerland

Job Type: Contract

TEKsystems, an Allegis Group company. Allegis Group AG, Aeschengraben 20, CH-4051 Basel, Switzerland. Registration No. CHE-101.865.121. TEKsystems is a company within the Allegis Group network of companies (collectively referred to as "Allegis Group"). Aerotek, Aston Carter, EASi, TEKsystems, Stamford Consultants and The Stamford Group are Allegis Group brands. If you apply, your personal data will be processed as described in the Allegis Group Online Privacy Notice available at https://www.allegisgroup.com/en-gb/privacy-notices.

To access our Online Privacy Notice, which explains what information we may collect, use, share, and store about you, and describes your rights and choices about this, please go to https://www.allegisgroup.com/en-gb/privacy-notices.

We are part of a global network of companies and as a result, the personal data you provide will be shared within Allegis Group and transferred and processed outside the UK, Switzerland and European Economic Area subject to the protections described in the Allegis Group Online Privacy Notice. We store personal data in the UK, EEA, Switzerland and the USA. If you would like to exercise your privacy rights, please visit the "Contacting Us" section of our Online Privacy Notice at https://www.allegisgroup.com/en-gb/privacy-notices for details on how to contact us. Title: Computer Vision & MLOps Engineer
Description:
About ARTIDIS

ARTIDIS AG is a clinical-stage health-tech start-up founded in Basel, Switzerland, that has developed the first nanomechanical biomarker for cancer diagnosis and treatment optimization. The ARTIDIS nanotechnology platform integrates different types of clinical data into the ARTIDISNET digital platform, allowing physicians to significantly shorten the current diagnostic process and benefit both the patient and the healthcare system. ARTIDIS enables professionals to design personalized cancer treatment plans tailored to individual patients' needs and desired outcomes.

Job Purpose

This role combines deep technical expertise in computer vision with strong MLOps capabilities to build and maintain production-grade AI systems.

Duties


Develop and deploy computer vision models for:
Medical image classification
Advanced segmentation
Complex image analysis
Implement solutions using deep learning and classical techniques
Optimize models for medical device and cloud deployment
Design and implement end-to-end ML pipelines
Manage model lifecycle from experimentation to production
Build, automate and maintain scalable MLOps infrastructure
Implement robust monitoring and observability solutions


Qualifications

Technical Skills - ML & Computer Vision:


Proficiency in Python data stack (TensorFlow, PyTorch, numpy, pandas, scikit-learn).
Experience with OpenCV and other relevant computer vision libraries.
Strong background in computer vision solutions for medical images.
Expertise in developing and implementing computer vision solutions mainly image segmentation and object recognition.


Technical Skills - DevOps & MLOps


Experience with Kubernetes operators and custom resources.
Proficiency in Docker containerization and multi-stage builds.
Advanced Git knowledge (branching strategies, workflows).
Experience Building and maintaining end-to-end ML pipelines.
Hands-on experience with Argo CD and Argo Workflows for ML pipelines.
Experience with infrastructure automation tools like: Helm charts for Kubernetes deployments.
Experience setting up and maintaining CI/CD pipelines.
Hands-on experience with model lifecycle management.
Hands-on experience with MLOps platforms: MLflow, Kubeflow...


Professional Skills


High level of expression and comprehension of the English language.
Experience in digital health and driving innovation in healthcare is highly desirable.
Commitment to writing documented, clear, efficient, and maintainable code.
Ability to design and implement requirements with long-term objectives, scalability, and maintainability in mind.
Proactive way of communicating and working.
Ability to work independently and take ownership without extensive supervision.
Strong team player.


Working Conditions

The environment is a typical start-up with an intrinsically motivated international team. Our company is an excellent place for rapid advancement and offers a promising opportunity to learn and share know-how in a very agile environment. The position requires the employee to go the extra mile when needed. We are looking for a team player who appreciates direct communication. The effort is rewarded with challenging tasks, the possibility to take responsibility, a highly driven team, and work serving a significant purpose. The job position comes with a competitive salary and a bonus for outstanding performance.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
I am collaborating with a very exciting, incredibly well backed, start up, Biotech company with offices in Amsterdam and Zurich




They are building a cutting-edge data platform and developing a multimodal foundation model that leverages complex datasets to improve cancer diagnosis, treatment, and patient outcomes.




I am looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with a focus on Benchmarking and Tooling to build the data-driven foundation that empowers our fast-growing team of ML researchers. Your mission is to establish a central source of truth for performance, enabling researchers to effortlessly measure the impact of code changes and track performance trends over time.




In this role, you’ll design and maintain systems that automate the tracking, analysis, and reporting of performance metrics across our models and infrastructure. Your work will directly inform optimization priorities and infrastructure decisions, playing a critical role in how we scale our systems.




Key Responsibilities




Develop and maintain a comprehensive suite of performance benchmarks to monitor model behavior across various hardware setups, software environments, and model versions.




Integrate benchmarks into our CI/CD pipelines and build intuitive, automated dashboards that make performance data accessible and actionable for engineers, researchers, and leadership.




Champion best practices for writing scalable, high-performance ML code. Share knowledge through documentation, tooling, and internal workshops that elevate performance literacy across teams.




Partner with infrastructure teams to provide data-driven insights into GPU and system performance, helping to identify and resolve complex performance issues across hardware and software layers.




Your profile




Strong background in software engineering, with advanced proficiency in Python.




Experience designing and maintaining automated benchmarking or testing frameworks.




Passion for building robust, maintainable systems that improve developer workflows and code performance.




Proficiency with CI/CD tools (e.g., GitHub Actions) and data visualization platforms to build informative and user-friendly performance dashboards.







Benefits




Comprehensive salary
Long term incentives
25+ days holiday
Clear development pathway




Following your application Joe Templeman, a specialist AI Recruiter will discuss the opportunity with you in detail.




He will be more than happy to answer any questions relating to the industry and the potential for your career growth. The conversation can also progress further to discussing other opportunities, which are also available right now or will be imminently becoming available.




This position has been highly popular, and it is likely that it will close prematurely. We recommend applying as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.




Please click ‘apply’ or contact Joe Templeman for any further information




Joe Templeman

Recruitment Manager – Barrington James

Email: jtempleman (at) barringtonjames.com

Following your application Joe Templeman, a specialist AI Recruiter will discuss the opportunity with you in detail.


He will be more than happy to answer any questions relating to the industry and the potential for your career growth. The conversation can also progress further to discussing other opportunities, which are also available right now or will be imminently becoming available.


This position has been highly popular, and it is likely that it will close prematurely. We recommend applying as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.


Please click ‘apply’ or contact Joe Templeman for any further information


Joe Templeman

Recruitment Manager – Barrington James

Email: jtempleman (at) barringtonjames.com

Title: Applied AI Research Scientist
Description:
On behalf of our client Hilo by Aktiia, and as part of an exclusive mandate, we are seeking a versatile and motivated individual to join their pioneering team as a




APPLIED AI RESEARCH SCIENTIST 100%




Company Overview

Hilo by Aktiia believes the key to improving cardiovascular health is to provide patients and physicians with a deeper understanding of the blood pressure pattern. Before Hilo, it was not possible to monitor cardiovascular health at scale.

They are an early-stage, venture-backed start-up that has raised over $96M from top-tier investors in Europe and the United States. They have developed and brought to market the world's first continuous blood pressure monitor. Their technology is based on 18 years of research by their founders at the prestigious Swiss Center for Electronics and Microtechnology (CSEM). Hilo by Aktiia's solution has been validated through extensive clinical trials and received a CE Mark as a Class IIa medical device under MDR leading to commercial access of approximately 43 countries worldwide.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, optimize, and document innovative AI models for blood pressure estimation from optical signals
Analyze model limitations and devise strategies to enhance performance, addressing key challenges




Your profile

Ph.D. in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Electrical Engineering, or a relevant field
Experience in developing, fine-tuning, and evaluating neural network architectures on large-scale datasets
Strong publication record in Machine Learning or AI
Deep understanding of statistical learning, CNNs, and RNNs
Proficiency in Python and machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, etc.)
Experience in time series analysis is a MUST.
Experience in medical signal processing or time series analysis is a plus
Strong communication skills in English (both written and spoken)
Motivated, proactive, and curious, with a structured, solution-oriented mindset; a team player eager to learn
Comfortable working in a multidisciplinary, multicultural, and diversity-oriented team
Based in Switzerland, with a valid Swiss work permit




Benefits

Pension
Competitive compensation package based on experience
Flexible work location (hybrid work schedule)







Are you passionate in solving problems with visionaries and innovative approaches?




Then Flurin Schwager looks forward to receiving your application documents or your call.

Title: Senior Data Scientist – Energy Forecasting
Description:
@Swiss-SDI: Trusted AI - Powerful Human




Type de contrat
Contrat à durée indéterminée avec période d’essai de 3 mois
dès maintenant
Entre 80-100%
Salaire: à discuter
Autres avantages (développement personnel, télétravail partiel, formation continue, etc.)




À propos de Swiss-SDI

Swiss Statistical Design & Innovation (Swiss-SDI) est une entreprise spécialisée en data science et intelligence artificielle. Nous intervenons sur deux axes principaux :

Le pôle Services, avec des projets sur mesure à forte valeur ajoutée : stratégie data, architecture, machine learning, mise en production.
Le pôle Produit, avec Foresia, notre solution propriétaire de prévision énergétique à court terme (15 min – 10 jours), utilisée aujourd’hui par près de 25% du marché suisse, en expansion rapide en Europe.

Chez Swiss-SDI, vous rejoignez une équipe technique, ambitieuse, bienveillante, dans laquelle chaque membre influence directement les solutions, les méthodes et les résultats.

Notre équipe est composée de 7 personnes avec des profils d’ingénieurs EPF, des mathématiciens, data scientists ou data engineers.




Votre mission – entre R&D de pointe et projets stratégiques




Un rôle à double impact

Vous serez une personne clef sur deux fronts :

Le développement avancé de Foresia, avec une forte composante R&D time series, deep learning, et industrialisation.
Des missions client sur mesure, dans des secteurs variés (énergie, transport, horlogerie, finance), où vous apporterez une expertise analytique complète.




Vos responsabilités




Côté Foresia (50%)
Mener des travaux de R&D appliquée : développement de modèles (Transformers, CNN, LSTM, foundation models), prototypage, expérimentation
Assurer la robustesse opérationnelle des modèles : real-time tuning, monitoring qualité, diagnostic
Concevoir et développer de nouveaux modules prédictifs : éolien, hydraulique, prix
Intégrer des méta-données complexes : météo forecast, données calendrier, signaux marché
Contribuer activement à la roadmap technique et aux décisions produit




Côté projets clients (50%)
Mener des projets data end-to-end : identification des besoins, exploration, modélisation, déploiement
Intervenir sur des cas analytiques complexes : séries temporelles, prédiction, détection d’anomalies, analyse de graphes, LLM
Accompagner les clients dans leur transition vers un modèle data-driven (cadrage, stratégie, architecture)
Assumer un rôle de référent technique, mentor pour l’équipe, et garant de la qualité technique des livrables




Profil recherché




Compétences techniques clés
Vous avez obtenu un master EPF en data science, mathématiques appliquées ou discipline similaire
Vous avez au moins trois ans d'expérience et avez déjà réalisé plusieurs mises en production de projets data science
Excellente maîtrise de Python 
Expertise avancée en modélisation de séries temporelles (y compris deep learning et architectures récentes (transformers, modèles de fondation, etc.)
Solide background en statistiques, machine learning et deep learning appliqué
Maîtrise de Git/GitHub, PostgreSQL, Airflow
Bonus : Docker, CI/CD, MLOps, cloud




Soft skills & mindset
Autonomie et rigueur technique élevées
Créativité, capacité à résoudre de manière élégante des problèmes complexes
Goût pour la R&D appliquée, la veille technologique, et l’expérimentation
Capacité à communiquer clairement avec des interlocuteurs non techniques
Envie de construire, structurer et faire grandir un produit et une équipe




Langues
Français courant
Anglais professionnel (écrit et oral)
Allemand = un réel plus




Ce que nous valorisons




Culture tech & R&D
Lecture et discussion de papers state-of-the-art
Prototypage rapide, benchmark rigoureux, peer reviews
Présence en conférences / webinars




Conditions de travail
Télétravail flexible (jusqu’à 4 jours/semaine)
Cadre bienveillant, autonome et exigeant
Budget dédié à la formation continue & conférences




Comment postuler

Pas de lettre de motivation demandée.

Envoyez simplement à info@swiss-sdi.ch :

Votre CV
Trois faits marquants de votre parcours
Décrivez (sans code) un projet IA/data science que vous avez mis en production : type de données, objectif, pipeline global, métriques d’évaluation.
Expliquez en quelques lignes un projet de forecasting complexe que vous avez mené, et les principales difficultés rencontrées.




Pour en savoir plus:

www.swiss-sdi.ch
https://fores-ia.com




Swiss-SDI 

Rue Joseph-Reichlen 4 
1700 Fribourg
 info@swiss-sdi.ch
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Ops Engineer
Description:
Richemont owns some of the world’s leading luxury goods Maisons, with strengths in jewelry, fine watches & premium accessories, including Cartier, Van Cleef & Arpels, Montblanc, Roger Dubuis, Vacheron Constantin, etc.

The Machine Learning Engineering team, belonging to “Richemont Group tech data platform”, supports this vision by developing the analytics and machine learning platform, best practices, templates and industrializing Analytics & AI Use Cases. This team is recruiting a Machine Learning Ops Engineer to work under the Lead Machine Learning Engineer.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?


Develop components of the analytics and machine learning platform, including: infrastructure modules, reusable components for AI/Analytics applications or architecture templates
Industrialize, maintain and improve AI and analytics solutions in Google Cloud Platform
Manage the infrastructure with special focus on reliance, security and scalability
Partner with Analytics Engineers, Data Scientists, Infrastructure & Data Engineers for the project delivery


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCESS WITH US?


Graduate in Master program in Engineering, Data Science, or related fields or equivalent professional experience
Proficient in Python programming & SQL (5 years or more)
Practical experience in MLOPs (3-5 years or more)
Professional experience in Google Cloud Platform (2 years +)
Practical experience with infrastructure as a code, ideally Terraform (1 years +)
Knowledge of Data Engineering principles
Knowledge of REST API and microservices
A dynamic, innovative & pragmatic mindset to problem solving, and an ability to think critically and objectively, both independently & within a team
Proactive, curious and autonomous with a strong sense of ownership and always on the look to improve the current solutions
Strong communication skills, English is a must, ease to collaborate in multicultural and multifunctional environments
Experience in Vertex AI and DBT is a plus


WHAT MAKES OUR GROUP DIFFERENT?

This is a fantastic opportunity to join the leader of luxury digital distribution as a builder of excellence for such a transformational practice. The business impact up for grasps, the AI use cases and diversity of stakeholders will make it rich, fast-paced, multicultural and fun for the right candidate.

Your Journey With Us

 1.    If your application is selected, we will reach out to you ASAP for an informal introductory call.


    The next step from there would be interviews with the Head of Data platform, Data Engineering team lead and our HR Business Partner.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?

At the core of Epic’s success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it’s building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we’re always innovating.

Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We’re constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.

ENGINEERING - UNREAL ENGINE

What We Do

Unreal-powered projects have been on the bleeding edge of real-time entertainment for over 20 years. Our team of engineering experts are always innovating to improve the tools and technology that empower content developers worldwide.

What You'll Do

We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to push the limits of our Neural Network Engine (NNE). NNE is the backbone of many ML applications in and outside Epic and comprises multiple inference backends running on various target systems. You will work closely with the team and other teams across Epic to keep UE’s ML inference engine at the forefront of the industry and thus you will be part of the foundational pillar for many ML products.

In this role, you will


Improve the MLIR/LLVM compiler toolchain to produce more performant ML code
Optimize neural network shader kernels within Unreal Engine
Update, maintain and extend different inference backends inside NNE
Collaborate with teams across Epic to integrate NNE into their products



What We're Looking For


Programming skills in C/C++ and Python
Experience with GPU programming (CUDA, DirectX or Metal) and shader languages (HLSL or GLSL)
Experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or JAX
Experience optimizing ML models for real-time inference on GPUs
Strong collaboration and communication skills
Ability to design and train a neural network given a problem would be an asset
Experience with MLIR and LLVM would be an asset



EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE

Our current benefits package includes sick pay and insurance, supplementary accident insurance (100% employer paid), as well as, a generous pension plan. We also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents.

About Us

Epic Games spans across 25 countries with 46 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we've been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic's award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.

Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!

Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

Note to Recruitment Agencies: Epic does not accept any unsolicited resumes or approaches from any unauthorized third party (including recruitment or placement agencies) (i.e., a third party with whom we do not have a negotiated and validly executed agreement). We will not pay any fees to any unauthorized third party. Further details on these matters can be found here.
Show more

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
At Pixel Plus, we are pioneering AI-driven solutions, combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies to build scalable, cutting-edge AI platforms tailored to our clients' needs. Our AI-powered platform enables rapid development and deployment of AI applications.




We are now looking for an AI Engineer to join our team and help shape the future of AI in our projects.




🚀 Join us and drive innovation at the intersection of proprietary and open-source AI!


Tasks



Design, develop, and optimize AI models by combining Azure AI Foundry with open-source technologies, LLMs, and machine learning services.


Enhance and scale our AI Platform, integrating RAG, LLMs, and ML pipelines into real-world applications.


Develop AI agents leveraging Azure AI Foundry and open-source frameworks, enabling a ChatGPT-like experience tailored to different industries.


Work closely with engineering teams to implement best practices in AI deployment, security, and performance.


Collaborate with clients to understand business needs and transform them into scalable AI-driven solutions.


Ensure seamless integration with Azure services and open-source tools, including Cognitive Services, OpenAI models, and vector databases.



Requirements



Proven experience working with Azure AI Foundry and open-source AI ecosystems.


Strong background in LLM fine-tuning, RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and AI-driven application development.


Proficiency in Python, ML frameworks, and cloud-native AI solutions.


Hands-on experience with Azure Cognitive Services, OpenAI APIs, and vector search.


Experience in AI security, MLOps, and deploying scalable AI solutions.


Ability to troubleshoot and optimize AI models for performance and accuracy.


Fluent in English (German is a plus).



Benefits



Exciting AI-driven projects with a strong focus on innovation.


Flexible work environment (remote or hybrid options).


Opportunity to lead AI initiatives in a fast-growing company.


Competitive salary & benefits.


Collaboration with AI & cloud experts shaping the future of AI.





Pixel Plus is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: AI Research Engineer for Manufacturing
Description:
inspire AG is the leading Swiss competence centre for product innovation and advanced manufacturing. As a strategic partner of ETH Zurich, our mission is to transfer knowledge and technology from research to Swiss machine, electrical and metal industries. The research group Intelligent Production Systems at inspire is based in Lugano, the southern part of Switzerland.




Our research group focuses on the development of AI algorithms for industrial applications. The main scope of our activities is the optimization and automation of workflows and production systems. Within this field, we are continuously developing and adopting various algorithms for multiple applications such as automating quality control, detecting process deviations and finally predicting the resulting product quality of the production systems.




Moreover, we are working towards technical Vision Language Models, where we are looking for a solution oriented and highly motivated research engineer. Your competences coupled with a can-do attitude enable you to resolve challenging problems with an industrial relevance.

The first main goal of your work will be to explore and develop algorithms to automatically process user manuals or process videos and extract relevant information. Further research will focus on advanced computer vision algorithms for defect detection. The research projects are usually part of a collaboration with a manufacturing company and require a good understanding of AI algorithms and their effective deployment.







Responsibilities

· Conduct research and development in the field of generative AI algorithms for manufacturing

· Collaborate with an interdisciplinary team to transform research results into innovative solutions

· Develop high-quality code and build the basis for our industrial AI platform

· Design methods, tools, and infrastructure for the efficient and effective deployment

· Continuously follow the advancements and implement novel approaches

· Collaborate with industrial and academic partners




Qualifications

· University degree or PhD in engineering with a focus on data science/AI

· Proficiency in Python and at least one further programming language such as C# or C++

· Proven track record of prototypes and/or research in the field of AI

· Experience with computer vision frameworks

· Experience with LLMs and Vision Language Models is a plus

· A good knowledge (written/oral) of English is mandatory. Knowledge of Italian, French and/or German will be an additional advantage

· CH/EU/EFTA citizenship or a valid work permit for Switzerland




We offer

· Full-time position at the forefront of AI for manufacturing

· Exciting topics and projects between academia and industry

· A flexible working culture with a self-organized job execution

· Participate at conferences, workshops and exhibitions

· Guidance and internal training provided by experienced professionals to enhance your professional growth




Please send your full application (cover letter, transcripts, CV, references) with reference ”AI research engineer for Manufacturing” to our HR department (hr@inspire.ch).

For technical questions, please contact Daniel Knüttel, Head of Intelligent Production Systems (daniel.knuettel@inspire.ch).

Title: AI Engineer Internship – LLM Applications
Description:
Job Description

We're now entering an exciting phase: integrating cutting-edge large language models (LLMs) and agentic solutions into our product. We're looking for motivated AI Engineer Interns to join us and help build state-of-the-art LLM-based applications that have a real impact on users.

What You'll Be Doing


Building and iterating on LLM-powered features within our platform
Developing and integrating backend services (APIs, pipelines, agents, etc.)
Researching and implementing best practices in LLMs and agentic systems
Working closely with a lean, experienced team shipping to production


Who We're Looking For

We're looking for smart, motivated people first and foremost. If you don't check every box, learning on the job is expected and encouraged.

You Might Be a Great Fit If


You have some hands-on experience with LLMs (OpenAI, open-source models, etc.)
You're fluent in Python and familiar with modern development practices
You've worked with web frameworks and can build APIs (FastAPI, Flask, etc.)
You follow AI/ML trends, try new tools, and think critically about how they apply
You enjoy working with probabilistic systems and making them feel robust and reliable
You care about user experience and building 0 to 1 product that will re-shape the financial service industry
You have an entrepreneurial mindset and you're a team player


Our Tech Stack


Backend: Python, FastAPI, SQLAlchemy, PostgreSQL
AI/LLM: OpenAI API, LangChain, LangGraph
Infra: Docker, GitHub, CI/CD (experience not required, but helpful)


If you're passionate about AI, eager to work on meaningful applications, and want to contribute to a growing product from day one, we'd love to hear from you.

Apply now and help us shape the future of LLM-powered fintech.

Interview Process


Small LLM coding project: Candidates will be required to complete a small coding project related to LLMs.
Technical Interview: This will consist of an interactive presentation of your project, discussing your choices and potential extensions. Additionally, there will be a few technical questions on AI engineering, machine learning theory, and basic software engineering.
Team Fit Interview: After the technical interview, candidates will meet with the product manager to assess team fit.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (NLP/LLM)
Description:
I am working with a very exciting, incredibly well backed, start up, Biotech company with offices in Amsterdam and Zurich. They are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to join their exciting team.




They are at the cutting edge of medical AI innovation, where you'll help shape products that empower clinicians to make faster, more informed decisions. I am looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Large Language Models (LLMs) to lead the development of advanced AI solutions from concept through validation.




In this role, you’ll collaborate with a cross-functional team of ML researchers, software engineers, UX designers, and healthcare professionals. You'll contribute to projects with real-world impact, helping to transform the future of healthcare.







Key Responsibilities




Translate complex clinical needs into innovative, practical NLP/LLM product ideas.
Build state-of-the-art LLM applications for healthcare using approaches such as fine-tuning, prompt engineering, or retrieval-augmented generation, tailored to each use case.
Design and maintain scalable pipelines for processing large volumes of unstructured clinical text, transforming it into instruction data suitable for fine-tuning and evaluating LLMs.
Lead rigorous experimentation and continuous iteration to ensure AI solutions are safe, trustworthy, and effective in clinical environments.




Experience




You have 4+ years of hands-on experience in machine learning, natural language processing, or a closely related field.
You're skilled at translating research into real-world applications, bridging the gap between prototyping and scalable, production-ready systems.
You're driven by a passion for building AI solutions that deliver meaningful value in clinical environments.




Bonus points if you have:




Experience working in the healthcare or medical technology sector.




Benefits




Comprehensive salary
Long term incentives
25+ days holiday
Clear development pathway




Following your application Joe Templeman, a specialist AI Recruiter will discuss the opportunity with you in detail.




He will be more than happy to answer any questions relating to the industry and the potential for your career growth. The conversation can also progress further to discussing other opportunities, which are also available right now or will be imminently becoming available.




This position has been highly popular, and it is likely that it will close prematurely. We recommend applying as soon as possible to avoid disappointment.




Please click ‘apply’ or contact Joe Templeman for any further information




Joe Templeman

Sales Manager – Artificial Intelligence

Email: jtempleman (at) barringtonjames.com

Show more

Title: Cloud ist deine DNA? Bewirb dich noch heute!
Description:
Du bist als professionelle Fachkraft auf der Suche nach Deiner nächsten beruflichen Herausforderung?

Bei der netaccess ag schätzen wir engagierte Personen, die neue Ideen, Know-How und Teamgeist in unser Unternehmen einbringen können.

Auch wenn wir derzeit keine offene Stelle haben, die Deinen Anforderungen entsprechen, könnten Deine einzigartigen Fähigkeiten und Erfahrungen vielleicht in Zukunft hervorragend zu uns passen.

Über uns: Als junges und motiviertes Team arbeiten wir gemeinsam an modernen Lösungen. Dabei ist unser oberstes Ziel, KMUs dabei zu unterstützen, die Herausforderungen der digitalen Welt zu meistern.

Wir arbeiten sowohl remote wie auch in unserem Büro in Ostermundigen.

Was dich auszeichnet:


Du verfügst über hervorragende Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse, gute Französischkenntnisse sind ein Plus.
Als kreativer Denker bringst du gerne neue Ideen ein und förderst Innovationen.
Du bist begeistert von neuen Technologien und immer bereit, dazuzulernen.
Du hast Freude am Umgang mit Menschen und bist teamfähig.



Das bieten wir dir:


Bei uns hast du die Chance, aktiv an der Gestaltung unserer IT-Lösungen und Dienstleistungen mitzuwirken.
Wir fördern deine Entwicklung mit passenden Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten in deinem Themenfeld und darüber hinaus, zudem erhältst Du bei Zertifizierungen einen Bonus.
Zu Beginn wirst du 5 Wochen Ferien geniessen dürfen, bleibst du länger bei uns sind es schon bald 6 Wochen.
Wir unterstützen Homeoffice, jedoch keine ausschliesslich remote Arbeitsplätze. Es liegt in Deiner Verantwortung, zu entscheiden, wann Du von zuhause arbeiten möchtest.
Wir sind ein familienfreundlicher Betrieb mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und der Möglichkeit von Kompensationstagen.
Natürlich haben wir auch eine Küche und Verpflegungsräumlichkeiten, gratis Parkplätze vor Ort, gratis Wasser und gratis Kaffee, einen Billard-Tisch und zu deinem Geburtstag erhältst Du einen freien Tag.
Du profitierst von überdurchschnittlichen Sozial- und Pensionskassen-leistungen.



So arbeiten wir:

Teamwork: Wir treffen uns regelmässig im Team (remote oder physisch) zur Besprechung der anstehenden Aufgaben und um gemeinsam Probleme zu lösen und Erfolge zu feiern. Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und helfen aus, wo wir benötigt werden.

Weiterbildung: Wir entwickeln uns ständig weiter und freuen uns, wenn auch du neue Lösungen entwickelst und neue Techniken mit uns testest. Mit regelmässigen Schulungen halten wir uns up to date!

Flexibilität: Bei uns ist der Arbeitsplatz flexibel und modern in jeder Hinsicht: Du kannst dir deine Arbeitsumgebung selbst gestalten oder von zu Hause arbeiten. Für uns ist Familie genauso wichtig wie die Arbeit, so finden wir auch für dich eine praktische Lösung, um alles unter einen Hut zu bringen.

So rekrutieren wir:


Phase: Vorauswahl der Bewerbungs-Dossiers
Phase: Kennenlernen in einem Video-Call
Phase: Vorauswahl aus den Video-Call Bewerbungsgesprächen
Phase: Persönliches Kennenlernen bei weiterem gegenseitigem Interesse
Phase: Schnuppertag/e
Phase: Vertragsunterzeichnung



So bewirbst Du Dich:

Bitte verwende zur Einreichung Deiner Initiativbewerbung das Bewerbungsformular.

Lade Dein Bewerbungsschreiben und Deinen Lebenslauf hoch und achte darauf, den gewünschten Stellenbereich anzugeben.

Unser Recruiting-Team wird sich an Dich wenden, sobald wir eine geeignete Stelle für Dich haben, welche perfekt zu Dir und Deinen Fähigkeiten passt.

Wir freuen uns auf Deine elektronischen Bewerbungsunterlagen

netaccess ag- keep IT smile!

Dein Ansprechpartner: Andreas Schweizer
Show more

Title: Research Scientist, GenAI Speech (London)
Description:
The GenAI Speech team is looking for a Research Scientist (Speech and Language). The GenAI Speech team works on large language models (LLMs) with native supporting for processing, understanding and generating of audio and speech as a modality besides others such as text or vision. As part of this, we are leveraging knowledge in areas like speech/audio encoders/tokenizer, pre-training, post-training, (online) reinforcement learning, LLM alignment, multimodal modelling, speech and audio processing, speech recognition (ASR), speech synthesis (TTS), and multilingual modelling. Our work is focused on advancing core technologies to drive and advance core product experiences at Meta such as Meta AI which is available on e.g. RayBan Meta glasses or within WhatsApp.

Research Scientist, GenAI Speech (London) Responsibilities:


Lead research to advance audio and speech technologies using large language models that can be applied to a wide area of Meta production use cases.
Work towards long-term ambitious research and production goals, while identifying intermediate milestones.
Influence progress of relevant research communities by producing publications.


Minimum Qualifications:


Ph.D. and established track record of leading and/or contributing to influential research, such as as evidenced by high-impact publications at peer-reviewed AI conferences (e.g. Interspeech, ICASSP, ASRU, SLT, NeurIPS, CVPR, ICML, ICLR, ICCV, ACL)
Experience in generative AI research, especially in building and optimising large language models for areas of audio/ speech processing and understanding, computer vision and/or natural language understanding.
Experience communicating research for public audiences of peers, as well as non-technical audiences.
Experience in leading theoretical and empirical research and for answering questions with research.
Experience in training, fine-tuning, and/or experimenting with foundation models beyond black-box use.
Familiarity with one or more deep learning frameworks (e.g. pytorch, tensorflow, …).


Preferred Qualifications:


2+ years of work experience in a faculty, industry, or government research position with primary emphasis on AI research.
Experience in building large language models for audio/ speech processing, understanding, and generation.
Experience driving original scholarship in collaboration with a team.
Experience in developing and debugging in C/C++, Python, PyTorch.


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Junior Data Scientist - Economics, Banking, Python, Matlab
Description:
Junior Data Scientist - Economics, Banking, Python, Matlab - vacancy for our Basel in the Financial Se sector.

Your tasks:

Clean, organise, and standardise data from diverse sources.
Prepare ready-for-use datasets for economists and researchers.
Implement quality control measures to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Interpret and manage data in alignment with research objectives.



Your experience/knowledge:


Strong foundation in data science as a Data Scientist/Research Analyst
Proficiency in Python and Matlab
Familiarity with statistical tools and techniques
Solid understanding of economics and financial markets
Language skills: English



Your soft skills:


Excellent comprehension skills with attention to detail
A high degree of self-organisation and time management

Title: MLOps
Description:
Infomaniak, c’est 30 ans de savoir-faire et plus de 270 passionné·e·s, avec une ambition commune : créer un cloud éthique sans compromis sur l’écologie, la vie privée et l’humain.

Nous créons des data centers qui sont à la pointe de l’innovation écologique et nous développons des services IaaS, PaaS et SaaS entièrement hébergés et développés en Suisse pour le B2B et le B2C. Nos solutions comprennent une suite d’applications collaboratives en ligne et des solutions d’hébergement cloud, de streaming, de marketing et d’événementiel.

Avec des millions d’utilisateurs et la confiance d’organisations publiques et privées dans toute l’Europe — telles que la RTBF, les Nations Unies, des banques centrales, plus de 3’000 radios et TV, et de nombreuses métropoles et organismes de sécurité — Infomaniak est une entreprise indépendante, engagée pour l’indépendance technologique en Europe, l’économie locale et un numérique plus soutenable pour la planète.

Es-tu prêt


e à rejoindre une entreprise en pleine croissance, à donner le meilleur de toi-même et à grandir avec nous afin de contribuer au développement d’une alternative éthique aux géants du Web ? Alors, nous avons hâte de te rencontrer !


Nous Recherchons Un·e

MLOps

Tes Responsabilités

Intégrer une des équipes en charge du développement et la maintenance de plusieurs produits et projets. De grandes nouveautés sont en préparation, tu seras amené à :


Bâtir, en équipe, le futur de l’hébergement et des outils collaboratifs chez infomaniak.
Développer de nouvelles fonctionnalités pour ces produits, ainsi que d’en assurer la maintenance et la qualité.


Le Profil Qui Nous Fait Vibrer


Tu maîtrises les outils et technologies clés de l’écosystème MLOps: conteneurisation (Docker, Kubernetes), monitoring (Grafana, Prometheus), observabilité (Elastic), versioning (Git), automatisation (CI/CD)
Tu es à l’aise avec Python
Tu as de l’expérience dans la mise en place et l’utilisation d’APIs REST
La sécurité, et les performances sont au centre de tes préoccupations
L’échange et le code review te sont familiers
Un niveau C2 en français ainsi qu’un niveau B2 en anglais te seront nécessaires pour faciliter ton intégration (documentation technique)


Un + si tu as des connaissances en :


Rust/C
Expérience professionnelle en Machine Learning (LLM, VLLM, Hugging face)
Fast API
Open source / Side project Les contributions open source ou les side projects sont appréciés
Tu aimes travailler en équipe, et fais preuve d’une communication positive
Ton humour, ta flexibilité et ton esprit d’équipe sont des atouts indispensables pour travailler dans le fun


Les compétences relationnelles que vous démontrerez


Tu as d’excellentes compétences en communication et en relations interpersonnelles.
Tu as un bon esprit d’initiative et une habilité à prioriser les tâches et les ressources de manière efficiente.
Tu es capable de fournir un retour constructif et efficace
Tu as de bonnes compétences d’écoute
Tu démontres une grande autonomie tout en restant ouvert à l’aide et aux retours des membres de l’équipe et des collègues


La stack technique que l’on utilise


Python
Docker / Kubernetes
Grafana / Prometheus
Sentry / ElasticSearch
Gitlab


Le Poste


Contrat à durée indéterminée
Taux d’occupation : 80 - 100%
Localisation : Genève
Disponibilité : Au plus vite


Les Étapes Du Processus De Recrutement


Un premier entretien technique pour valider tes compétences.
Un second entretien dans nos bureaux


Pourquoi Infomaniak


Fais partie d’une entreprise qui façonne un cloud éthique qui respecte la vie privée, l’humain et l’environnement.
Travaille chaque jour dans un cadre bienveillant, équilibré avec ta vie personnelle et extrêmement stimulant avec des personnes à la pointe de leur domaine qui sont engagées, à l’écoute et passionnées par ce qu’elles font.
Fais une véritable différence dans la vie de millions d’utilisateurs à travers le monde. Chez Infomaniak, nous sommes tous réunis par la sensation d’avoir de réelles responsabilités et de contribuer à quelque chose de plus grand.
Rencontre des personnes diversifiées dans un climat convivial lors de sorties d’entreprise très régulières (Afterwork, ski, sortie vélo, théâtre, etc.).
Évolue dans un climat très agréable et dans un cadre de travail original, où les salles de réunion sont décorées avec soin et qui favorisent l’inspiration ainsi que la collaboration.
Profite de nombreux autres avantages comme une prime annuelle incitant à la mobilité douce, une salle de fitness pour te maintenir en forme, la mise à disposition de vélos et trottinettes électriques, des espaces de détente conviviaux (salle de repos, jeux vidéos et d’arcade, flipper, babyfoot, etc.), une excellente couverture accident et perte de gain, et d’autres surprises encore.


Pour que ta candidature soit prise en compte, écris-nous en 10 lignes (sans l’IA) pourquoi ce poste chez Infomaniak te plaît et ferait sens pour toi.

Chez Infomaniak, nous nous engageons en faveur de la diversité, de l’équité et de l’inclusion des collaborateurs·trices sur le lieu de travail. Nos offres d’emploi sont ouvertes à tous·tes et tous les dossiers de candidatures sont évalués sur un pied d’égalité, qu’importe le genre, l’origine, la religion, l’orientation sexuelle ou le handicap des candidat·e·s.

Benefits and advantages

Ta vie privée et ton temps sont précieux

Toutes tes heures sont payées. Tes heures supplémentaires sont récupérées et le congé paternité est de 3 semaines (au lieu des 2 semaines prévues par la loi).

Télétravail et horaires flexibles

Nous pensons qu’il est indispensable d'avoir des équipes soudées et proches les unes des autres, et tout est fait pour que chacun(e) se sente bien sur son lieu de travail. Jusqu’à 2 jours de télétravail sont possibles pour les personnes qui ont besoin de plus de souplesse.

Travailler sérieusement, mais avec du fun

Il y a très régulièrement des sorties originales qui te permettent de découvrir des activités et de rire avec tes collègues.

Tu aimes la planète ? Nous aussi

Selon ton moyen de transport pour te rendre au travail, tu profites d’une prime allant jusqu’à CHF 1500 par an.

Ton revenu est assuré en cas de maladie

Si tu es malade et que tu ne peux pas travailler, Infomaniak dépasse les exigences de la loi et tu reçois 100% de ton salaire.

Nous pensons à ton futur

Notre caisse de pension est éthique et Infomaniak dépasse les exigences de la loi pour ta retraite (salaires LPP déplafonnés).

La santé est ce que nous avons de plus précieux

Chez Infomaniak, tu es couvert par une Assurance Accident Complémentaire Privée (LAAC). Tu reçois les meilleurs soins dans les meilleures conditions possibles en cas d’accident.

Apply on Jobup

OneAPPS Consulting (www.oneapps.com) is a Technology consulting firm based out of Zurich, Switzerland and offices across Europe. We are working on various projects involving diverse, multicultural teams with clients across the Europe. We are an invaluable partner and our teams have collaborated to support the growth of our clients. With more than 7 locations worldwide we help our clients to deliver their projects smoothly. We look forward to getting to know you and working with you.




Strong foundational IT knowledge, good with Object Oriented and Functional programming,
Good with python skillsets.
Experience on RAG & LLMs / AI agentic framework
Machine learning experience in LLM fine tunning, narrow model building.
Excellent MLOps experience with MLFlow knowledge
Azure experience, Azure DevOps. Azure GraphAPI, authentications.

Domain: Investment Banking




Location: Zurich




If this role sounds like you, we invite you to apply. Thanks.

Wir sind immer auf der Suche nach tollen Kolleginnen und Kollegen, welche uns helfen, Open Source Lösungen zu erstellen, zu implementieren, zu bewerben und zu verkaufen.




Willst du deine Qualität und Expertise bei uns einbringen und helfen, unsere Kunden glücklich zu machen? Dann sende uns dein CV und dein Motivationsschreiben und vielleicht bist du schon bald Teil des Teams!

Title: AI/LLM Engineer
Description:
Our client, a ML Focused consultancy are looking for a German-speaking AI Engineering Consultant to join a fast-growing team in Basel and drive impactful AI transformations! (They also have a several ongoing projects in Zurich)🔥

💡 Why this role?
You’ll be at the forefront of AI & ML adoption, helping organizations design, build & scale ML solutions beyond prototypes. You won’t just write code—you’ll shape AI strategy, implement best practices, and enable teams to unlock the full potential of AI.

🌍 Your impact:
✅ Consult & Engineer: Work with cutting-edge ML, LLMs & Generative AI technologies to solve real-world challenges.
✅ End-to-End AI Operations: Design & optimize data, model & code pipelines (DataOps, MLOps & DevOps).
✅ Technical Leadership: Be a trusted advisor, shape solution blueprints, and drive AI engineering excellence.
✅ Collaboration & Enablement: Work closely with teams to operationalize AI & ensure reliability, scalability, and automation.

🔍 What you bring:
🔹 3+ years of experience in ML, AI, or Software Engineering
🔹 Hands-on expertise in ML models, LLMs, and Data/AI platforms (Snowflake, Databricks, etc.)
🔹 Strong understanding of DataOps, DevOps, and MLOps best practices
🔹 Passion for scaling AI beyond POCs & driving enterprise AI success

Title: Research Scientist - Neuroscience (60-70%*)
Description:
Summary

The Neuroscience Department within BioMedical Research at Novartis Pharma AG in Basel, Switzerland, is searching for a motivated and experienced Research or Senior Scientist. This individual will assume a hands-on role within the in vivo neuroinflammation team and contribute to several research projects focused on the development of new therapies for neurodegenerative disorders, potentially helping improve the lives of millions of patients worldwide suffering neurodegenerative illnesses and conditions.

The main focus will be on novel neuroimmune cell pathways to elucidate the mechanisms at the molecular, cellular and ex vivo/in vivo level.

Joining our team you will independently but with close collaboration with the other members of the Neurosciences group plan, execute, document, analyze and interpret experiments.


Please note that this is a part time job share position with a maximum 70% working time


About The Role

Your responsibilities will include:


Designing, conducting and protocolling independently in vivo studies with specific focus on neuroinflammatory pathways
Establishment of new in vivo models for neuroinflammatory/neurodegenerative diseases
Performing and interpreting ex vivo analyses with emphasis on histology, biochemistry, FACS and molecular biology
Development and execution of in vitro cellular assays for assessing inflammatory processes
Presenting data and putting it in a complex context
Supporting general laboratory duties


Your Profile


University degree (MSc) or equivalent qualification, preferably in neuroscience, immunology, cell biology. *Please note that PhD candidates will not be considered for this position*
Minimum 2-3 years relevant lab based work experience in an industrial or academic setting
Previous experience in neuroscience drug discovery area would be an advantage.
60-70% job position
Strong expertise in in vivo rodent work e.g. different routes of dosing, surgery, stereotactic brain injections, behavior, perfusion. Relevant animal experiment course available (e.g. LTK1)
Experience in different histological methods, microscopy and image analyses
Experience in RNA/DNA technologies and biochemistry, e.g. qPCR technologies, Westernblot
Good knowledge of immunology and immunological methods such as flow cytometry, HTRF, ELISA
Good knowledge in cell culture work, e.g. primary cells, iPSCs
Used to evaluating large datasets, strong documentation capabilities and interest to use new informatics analysis tools
Eager to learn and combine new techniques and concepts, to present results within the lab, to use and apply literature data, to perform exploratory activities and to work independently and as a team member
Scientific curiosity, initiative, commitment, flexibility and good organization skills
Track record of successful collaborations, open communication with different stakeholders, strong team player and networker
Excellent oral and written English


Accessibility and accommodation

Novartis is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to all individuals. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the recruitment process, or in order to receive more detailed information about the essential functions of a position, please send an e-mail to inclusion.switzerland@novartis.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Please include the job requisition number in your message.

Why Novartis: Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Join our Novartis Network: Not the right Novartis role for you? Sign up to our talent community to stay connected and learn about suitable career opportunities as soon as they come up: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Benefits and Rewards: Read our handbook to learn about all the ways we’ll help you thrive personally and professionally: https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

The main focus will be on novel neuroimmune cell pathways to elucidate the mechanisms at the molecular, cellular and ex vivo/in vivo level.

Joining our team you will independently but with close collaboration with the other members of the Neurosciences group plan, execute, document, analyze and interpret experiments.

  • Please note that this is a part time job share position with a maximum 70% working time

About The Role

Your responsibilities will include:

  • Designing, conducting and protocolling independently in vivo studies with specific focus on neuroinflammatory pathways
  • Establishment of new in vivo models for neuroinflammatory/neurodegenerative diseases
  • Performing and interpreting ex vivo analyses with emphasis on histology, biochemistry, FACS and molecular biology
  • Development and execution of in vitro cellular assays for assessing inflammatory processes
  • Presenting data and putting it in a complex context
  • Supporting general laboratory duties

Your Profile

  • University degree (MSc) or equivalent qualification, preferably in neuroscience, immunology, cell biology. *Please note that PhD candidates will not be considered for this position*
  • Minimum 2-3 years relevant lab based work experience in an industrial or academic setting
  • Previous experience in neuroscience drug discovery area would be an advantage.
  • 60-70% job position
  • Strong expertise in in vivo rodent work e.g. different routes of dosing, surgery, stereotactic brain injections, behavior, perfusion. Relevant animal experiment course available (e.g. LTK1)
  • Experience in different histological methods, microscopy and image analyses
  • Experience in RNA/DNA technologies and biochemistry, e.g. qPCR technologies, Westernblot
  • Good knowledge of immunology and immunological methods such as flow cytometry, HTRF, ELISA
  • Good knowledge in cell culture work, e.g. primary cells, iPSCs
  • Used to evaluating large datasets, strong documentation capabilities and interest to use new informatics analysis tools
  • Eager to learn and combine new techniques and concepts, to present results within the lab, to use and apply literature data, to perform exploratory activities and to work independently and as a team member
  • Scientific curiosity, initiative, commitment, flexibility and good organization skills
  • Track record of successful collaborations, open communication with different stakeholders, strong team player and networker
  • Excellent oral and written English

Accessibility and accommodation

Novartis is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to all individuals. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the recruitment process, or in order to receive more detailed information about the essential functions of a position, please send an e-mail to inclusion.switzerland@novartis.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Please include the job requisition number in your message.

Why Novartis: Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Join our Novartis Network: Not the right Novartis role for you? Sign up to our talent community to stay connected and learn about suitable career opportunities as soon as they come up: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Benefits and Rewards: Read our handbook to learn about all the ways we’ll help you thrive personally and professionally: https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

Title: Internship Python department (m/f/d)
Description:
Internship Python department (m/f/d)

Job-ID: 12642

Start Date: ab sofort

Location:

Zürich, CH, 8005

Country: CH

What You Should Know About Us

Everllence enables its customers to achieve sustainable value creation in the transition towards a carbon neutral future. Addressing tomorrow’s challenges within the marine, energy and industrial sectors, we improve efficiency and performance at a systemic level. Leading the way in advanced engineering for more than 250 years, we provide a unique portfolio of technologies. Headquartered in Germany, Everllence employs some 15,000 people at over 120 sites globally. Our after-sales brand, Everllence PrimeServ, offers a vast network of service centres to our customers all over the world.

We can offer you the following tasks


Develop small scale programs to assist operational and transactional tasks with Python, Power Apps and similar tools
Write and test codes, debugging programs, and integrating other applications
Optimize Python-based applications


You Can Help Us With These Qualifications


Strong IT skills
Data Analysis skills
Python programming skills
Inner drive and self-motivation
Very good coordination, organization and communication skills
Establish good collaboration with other departments


Our Benefits For You


Top location in Zurich West: Our location is not only attractive, but also easy to reach
Flexibility is important to us: We offer flexible working time models (where possible) so that you can harmonise work and life
Feasting made easy: You'll find affordable catering options in trendy restaurants nearby
Your health matters: We value accessibility and our company health management programme includes a company doctor who looks after your well-being
Employee discounts: With us, you benefit from interesting employee discounts
Our culture: With us, the "Du" is a matter of course - an open "Du" culture
Modern social benefits: We offer modern and attractive social benefits that match your needs


Good to know

Feel free to contact Laura Schmid if you have any questions. Email: laura.schmid@everllence.com

Please only apply via the “Apply now” button. Unfortunately, applications via email cannot be considered.

Your professional home

In the heart of Zurich, world-class technology comes to life at Everllence Switzerland where 800 employees – from over 40 nations – are responsible for the development, design, production, sales and service of highly digitalized compressor systems. Here, the focus is always on quality and innovation for the benefit of our customers that use the technology in critical industrial processes globally within the energy and chemical industries. In these key sectors of the global economy, we are driving the energy transition towards a climate-neutral future. Everllence Switzerland’s most important asset is our employees whose professional and personal growth we consider key. This is why we promote an open work culture based on the values of trust, flexibility, professionalism, efficiency and freedom. At Everllence, everyone has the opportunity to contribute and make a real difference for future generations.

That is important to us

Integrity and Compliance are essential elements of our corporate culture. We firmly support diversity and equal opportunities and are therefore looking forward to receiving a diverse range of applications. Just click on “Apply now” and start your career with us. Applications from people with disabilities are strongly encouraged.

Title: Data Scientist Operations
Description:
Arxada is a global specialty chemicals business that’s committed to solving the world’s toughest preservation challenges through better science. [With a proud history of innovation dating back more than a century], we aim to help our customers develop more sustainable solutions that protect and maintain the health and wellbeing of people and extend the life of vital infrastructure while working to reduce our and our customers’ ecological footprint.

Sustainable preservation is one of our top priorities. We are making significant strategic investments that will not only decrease our own environmental footprint, but also help customers adapt to long-term environmental and social change through the development of cleaner, greener solutions.

The Data Scientist Operations is crucial to optimize production processes and productivity through the application of data analytics and data insights to the production environment – solve business problems through data.

He / she will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, developing predictive models, and implementing AI-driven solutions to enhance operational efficiency and productivity.

The person will work very closely with business operations in order to tell the productivity story through data, and with other IT functions to understand data, application, and infrastructure dependencies.

The person has a strong background in data structures, data analytics, Artificial Intelligence, and operational technology, and he / she is familiar with OSISoft and Seeq solutions.

Key Accountabilities:


Collaborate with commercial, R&D, and process teams to identify pain points and opportunities using customer journey mapping and process analysis.
Propose and implement data-driven solutions, using proof of concept and experimentation when needed.
Analyze complex data sets to uncover trends and generate actionable insights.
Integrate AI and data solutions into OT systems to enhance automation, decision-making, and compliance.
Translate business needs into data strategies and develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations for stakeholders.
Partner with cross-functional teams, vendors, and OEMs to understand and leverage OT and IT data sources.
Apply Agile principles, ensure standardization, documentation, training, and compliance with data and security standards.
Stay current on trends in data analytics, visualization, and OT technologies.


Key Skills & Experience:


Proficient in Python, R, SQL; familiar with ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) and visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Solid understanding of manufacturing, supply chain, and R&D environments.
Experience with OT infrastructure (e.g., OSIsoft PI, MSSQL, Seeq) and data integration in complex environments.
Skilled in Agile project management and able to work independently or in teams.
Demonstrated ability to troubleshoot issues, manage stakeholders, and drive innovation.
Experience in delivering compliant IT/OT systems in regulated environments.


Arxada has world class offering in two distinct areas:

Microbial Control Solutions (MCS) focuses on threats posed by microorganisms to people and planet through five distinct business lines including Professional Hygiene, Home & Personal Care, Wood Protection, Paints & Coatings and Material Protection.

Nutrition, Care & Environmental (NCE), meanwhile, provides materials used to manufacture composites for electronics, aerospace and other markets, as well as vitamins and nutritional ingredients, chemicals and performance intermediates, and raw materials for a wide range of high-performance applications.

Arxada is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

CH15

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Python Engineer - Houston - Energy Trading - $150k




RJC is working a Python Engineer role for a global energy trading company based in Geneva. Working as part of the Data Analytics team within the Front Office, they are looking for a developer to assist in the creation of a data platform to feed live market data to commodity trading desks.




The role demands expertise in Python Development,, ability to work closely with commercial trading teams and strong architectural infrastructure skills.




Responsibilities:

Build and develop software applications for trading teams
More alongside Data teams to deliver modelling solutions
Build and maintain key infrastructure
Be a key plater in making technical decisions and driving team performance.




the ideal candidate:

Minimum 5+ years Python development experience
Strong educational background with MSc or PhD in comp science related subject
Experience with data engineering and cloud computing
Ideally some exposure to trading or commodities




The Role:

4 days a week in Central Geneva
Full relocation offered for UK/EU citizens
Fantastic benefits
Industry leading bonus structure

Title: Associate Scientist
Description:
Associate Scientist Technical Development (M/F/D)

Tasks:

Independent planning, execution, documentation, and interpretation of a wide range of experiments in compound characterization and formulation development.
Conducting analytical investigations such as physicochemical characterization of drug substances and products, including solid-state analyses using techniques such as DSC, TGA, XRPD, and DVS.
Performing formulation development activities, such as solution/suspension formulation screening and characterization (e.g., visual assessment, material content, stability).
Participating in scale-up experiments and managing supply activities for pre-clinical PK and tox studies
Operating, troubleshooting, and maintaining laboratory instruments (e.g., HPLC, DSC, XRPD) and infrastructure
Ensuring compliance with safety and quality protocols, especially in handling chemicals, and managing potentially hazardous materials and equipment.

Qualification:

Certified Laboratory Technician or University graduate with equivalent technical/academic training (e.g., BSc/MSc in Formulation Sciences, Analytics, Chemistry, Pharmaceutics, or Material Sciences).
Proven experience in small-scale material handling is essential.
Direct work experience in fields like formulation, analytical chemistry, or material science is highly desirable.
Technical Expertise & Skills:
Proficiency in wet chemistry techniques (HPLC/UPLC) and powder characterization analytics (DSC, TGA, XRPD, DVS).
Strong knowledge of laboratory tools, procedures, and methods commonly used in pharmaceutical or chemical R&D.
Hands-on experience in HPLC method development and stability testing is highly valued.
Familiarity with data and digital tools is a plus.
Excellent organizational and planning skills with a structured approach to problem-solving.
Ability to adapt and thrive in a highly dynamic environment, embracing an agile and flexible mindset.
Strong sense of urgency and an ability to keep customer focus front and center in all deliverables.
Exceptional collaboration and communication skills, with a proven ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary teams.
Fluency in English is essential. (Proficiency in German and/or French is an advantage).

Requirements:

Start: 18.08.2025

Duration: 12 months

Capacity: 50%

Location: Basel, Switzerland

Show more
